commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ib597a4c03b312f8f095459b6f5038658780ffeca

commit_message:
Fix barbican client with application credentials/trusts

It seems that keystoneauth1.identity.generic.token doesn't handle
properly the application credential/trust tokens passed by the context
of the requests. When using app credentials, Octavia failed to retrieve
the certificates from barbican.
Switching to keystoneauth1.token_endpoint fixes the issue, the
auth tokens are correctly passed to the barbican client.

Story: 2007619
Task: 39737

Change-Id: Id77ce36f59b71d309f153e5c1d44059f162ee440
(cherry picked from commit ce7f27e3b7ef6a94501ce975fb0e9dadcffb822b)

commit_message:
Add missing OsloMessagingNotify svc into Cell crlr

The cell controller role should also cover the messaging
transport configuration for notifications.

Related: rhbz#2089512
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0ace4e703f2b71a068b90f9f3e069e2910921c52

subject: Fix ovn_controller certificate principal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-18 14:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ovn/ovn-controller-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/fff7034a930f2fa82f996060f835bf09cef9d433', 'message': 'Fix ovn_controller certificate principal

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/822313/
changed the way the certificate principal is defined in hieradata to
match what is returned by getcert list, so that the puppet comparisons
would match correctly.  Otherwise, puppet would think that the cert
resource has changed and always request a new cert.

One of the certificates was missed though - ovn_controller.

Change-Id: I61bc5545277204803ffd0ba626a55e3f7826e317
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ovn_controller certificate principal

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/822313/
changed the way the certificate principal is defined in hieradata to
match what is returned by getcert list, so that the puppet comparisons
would match correctly.  Otherwise, puppet would think that the cert
resource has changed and always request a new cert.

One of the certificates was missed though - ovn_controller.

Change-Id: I61bc5545277204803ffd0ba626a55e3f7826e317

commit_message:
Add scenario tests for failover circuit breaker

* Checks whether stale amphorae get set to FAILOVER_STOPPED
* Assumes failover_threshold set to 2
* Tests both recovery of stale amps and manual failover of
  amphorae in FAILOVER_STOPPED
* Once the number of stale amphorae gets below the threshold
  automatic failover should resume

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/656811

Story: 2005604
Task: 30837
Change-Id: I37a50dd5cad83deeefb064f3186badb82a137ad7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/78/837878/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job: name: octavia-v2-failover-cb-dsvm-scenario parent: octavia-dsvm-live-base vars: devstack_local_conf: post-config: $OCTAVIA_CONF: api_settings: api_v1_enabled: False controller_worker: loadbalancer_topology: ACTIVE_STANDBY health_manager: health_check_interval: 20 failover_threshold: 2 task_flow: engine: parallel tempest_concurrency: 2 tempest_test_regex: ^octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.failover_circuit_breaker.v2.test_failover_cb\. tox_envlist: all

commit_message:
WIP bz2123291 remove leapp packages before the dnf distro-sync

Change-Id: If11835867568e45b0ae8b2951b0723a4ee5e32bb

commit_message:
Release python-ironicclient for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to python-ironicclient since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.6.3..ceded7a
c61bf1b Avoid using 'foo' as invalid JSON test data
a0bfe0e Validate path when passing a config-drive

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I3f1f2c7ad373607cf7de296d6b98cc1177ae7579

subject: Run dmesg command with sudo
revisions:

It seems that setting "sysctl kernel.dmesg_restrict" was changed
in Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy) to "1" and because of that running "dmesg"
command requires now root privileges.

Closes-bug: #1994023

Change-Id: I2adc76e3025fadf994bab2e2e1fd608e688874fc
'}]
commit_message:
Run dmesg command with sudo

It seems that setting "sysctl kernel.dmesg_restrict" was changed
in Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy) to "1" and because of that running "dmesg"
command requires now root privileges.

Closes-bug: #1994023

Change-Id: I2adc76e3025fadf994bab2e2e1fd608e688874fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/79/862479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo modprobe $module || (sudo dmesg && die $LINENO "FAILED TO LOAD $module") sudo modprobe $module || (echo "FAILED TO LOAD $module" && sudo dmesg) sudo dmesg | tail
deleted_lines: sudo modprobe $module || (dmesg && die $LINENO "FAILED TO LOAD $module") sudo modprobe $module || (echo "FAILED TO LOAD $module" && dmesg) dmesg | tail

commit_message:
Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method

The setDaemon method of the threading.Thread was deprecated
in Python 3.10 (*).
Replace the setDaemon method with the daemon property.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.10/library/threading.html#threading.Thread.setDaemon

Change-Id: I34c7753ae1ba3704a1c2ec1a9b5a9905b6bcb8f5
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

It seems that keystoneauth1.identity.generic.token doesn't handle
properly the application credential/trust tokens passed by the context
of the requests. When using app credentials, Octavia failed to retrieve
the certificates from barbican.
Switching to keystoneauth1.token_endpoint fixes the issue, the
auth tokens are correctly passed to the barbican client.

Story: 2007619
Task: 39737

Change-Id: Id77ce36f59b71d309f153e5c1d44059f162ee440

commit_message:
Fix barbican client with application credentials/trusts

It seems that keystoneauth1.identity.generic.token doesn't handle
properly the application credential/trust tokens passed by the context
of the requests. When using app credentials, Octavia failed to retrieve
the certificates from barbican.
Switching to keystoneauth1.token_endpoint fixes the issue, the
auth tokens are correctly passed to the barbican client.

Story: 2007619
Task: 39737

Change-Id: Id77ce36f59b71d309f153e5c1d44059f162ee440
(cherry picked from commit ce7f27e3b7ef6a94501ce975fb0e9dadcffb822b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/93/859793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix barbican client with application credentials/trusts

It seems that keystoneauth1.identity.generic.token doesn't handle
properly the application credential/trust tokens passed by the context
of the requests. When using app credentials, Octavia failed to retrieve
the certificates from barbican.
Switching to keystoneauth1.token_endpoint fixes the issue, the
auth tokens are correctly passed to the barbican client.

Story: 2007619
Task: 39737

Change-Id: Id77ce36f59b71d309f153e5c1d44059f162ee440
(cherry picked from commit ce7f27e3b7ef6a94501ce975fb0e9dadcffb822b)

commit_message:
Remove leftover of Fluentd support

Fluentd support was already removed. This removes the healthcheck
script which we should have removed when removing the container image.

Change-Id: Ic53b72d0aee4851935f1d2069c7daecd1a9db00b

commit_message:
Fix prometheus-proxy service name in Red Hat-based distros

The prometheus-proxy service is called octavia-prometheus-proxy in RDO's
RPMs [0].
Add a svc-map for the service name to fix the amphora-agent element for
these distros.

[0] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/octavia-distgit/+/44152

Partial-Bug: 1992668

Change-Id: Ie739cd582103d1aab3021c56654e395b5919358f
(cherry picked from commit 344d6d76ce4481f30fe295114551243d61e7eea8)

commit_message:
Add featureset to allowed list

This patch add the following featureset groups:
* featureset020
* featureset020_periodic
* featureset063
* featureset064

Note 063 and 064 doesn't have a periodic group since these jobs run the
same set of tests for both periodic and check jobs.

Change-Id: I4fea2941225c8d8c01932931783c59370b245130

commit_message:
Add Python MySQL drivers to the horizon container

Horizon has an option for using a MySQL database for session storage in
place of Memcached, and some customers prefer that option. However, for
that to work we need to have the Python MySQL drivers installed in the
container.

Change-Id: Ic31b39811eebc0a0e65df94e08e38b39d24a7015
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/80/861080/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
search_images replaced with image.images

search_images with latest openstacksdk (0.102.0) return empty list
if any parameter passed to the query. At the same time image.images
function is still working, just params for the search should be
passed as preperties and not filters.
name_or_id parameter is ignored, so if image is specified, first it
is tried by id and then by name.

Change-Id: Ib89eed27b83b80e4674ce3a90f3932ad8f3e9ceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/18/862518/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix flavor specification at instance overview page

The details page uses flavor id to resolve instance flavor, relying
on legacy Nova API v2.46. This patch adds the current Nova API
option, resolving instance flavor by flavor name, so flavor
specification at instance overview page is displayed properly.

Change-Id: I1fe45063c9d1cdd8682998329d81f843d30f80b3
(cherry picked from commit d0e9e976f2769b289196d481b0928893b702b011)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/64/860464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: flavor_id = instance.flavor.get('id') try: if flavor_id: # Nova API <= 2.46 instance.full_flavor = api.nova.flavor_get( self.request, flavor_id) else: flavors = api.nova.flavor_list(self.request) flavor_name_dict = dict((str(f.name), f) for f in flavors) instance.full_flavor = \ flavor_name_dict[instance.flavor['original_name']]

commit_message:
libvirt: Add announce-self post live-migration workaround

NOTE(melwitt): This is the combination of two commits, the workaround
config option and a followup change to add a note that enabling the
workaround will cause the guest domain to be considered tainted by
libvirt.

This patch adds a workaround that can be enabled
to send an announce_self QEMU monitor command
post live-migration to send out RARP frames
that was lost due to port binding or flows not
being installed.

Please note that this makes marks the domain
in libvirt as tainted.

See previous information about this issue in
the [1] bug.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1815989

Related-Bug: 1815989

Update announce self workaround opt description

This updates the announce self workaround config opt
description to include info about instance being set
as tainted by libvirt.

Change-Id: I8140c8fe592dd54fc09a9510723892806db49a56
(cherry picked from commit 2aa1ed5810b67b9a8f18b2ec5e21004f93831168)

Conflicts:
    nova/conf/workarounds.py

Change-Id: I7a6a6fe5f5b23e76948b59a85ca9be075a1c2d6d
(cherry picked from commit d44e24efe28e825fbfd2c75a032bf2d10109a439)
(cherry picked from commit a8981422afdd09f8cfea053e592c15e771fbe969)
(cherry picked from commit c578b5d094a37719aa8e22e52fdd0c3a525011e0)

commit_message:
libvirt: Add announce-self post live-migration workaround

NOTE(melwitt): This is the combination of two commits, the workaround
config option and a followup change to add a note that enabling the
workaround will cause the guest domain to be considered tainted by
libvirt.

This patch adds a workaround that can be enabled
to send an announce_self QEMU monitor command
post live-migration to send out RARP frames
that was lost due to port binding or flows not
being installed.

Please note that this makes marks the domain
in libvirt as tainted.

See previous information about this issue in
the [1] bug.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1815989

Related-Bug: 1815989

Update announce self workaround opt description

This updates the announce self workaround config opt
description to include info about instance being set
as tainted by libvirt.

Change-Id: I8140c8fe592dd54fc09a9510723892806db49a56
(cherry picked from commit 2aa1ed5810b67b9a8f18b2ec5e21004f93831168)

Conflicts:
    nova/conf/workarounds.py

Change-Id: I7a6a6fe5f5b23e76948b59a85ca9be075a1c2d6d
(cherry picked from commit d44e24efe28e825fbfd2c75a032bf2d10109a439)

commit_message:
libvirt: Add announce-self post live-migration workaround

NOTE(melwitt): This is the combination of two commits, the workaround
config option and a followup change to add a note that enabling the
workaround will cause the guest domain to be considered tainted by
libvirt.

This patch adds a workaround that can be enabled
to send an announce_self QEMU monitor command
post live-migration to send out RARP frames
that was lost due to port binding or flows not
being installed.

Please note that this makes marks the domain
in libvirt as tainted.

See previous information about this issue in
the [1] bug.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1815989

Related-Bug: 1815989

Update announce self workaround opt description

This updates the announce self workaround config opt
description to include info about instance being set
as tainted by libvirt.

plugin, and this service resource has never been used.

commit_message:
fencing: Remove unused logic to detect deployment type

The tripleo::fencing class is used only at host and is not used by
puppet run inside containers. Thus checking the deployment_type fact
is useless and we can always assume the class is executed at host.

Change-Id: I87c78b6d12eeec7c69ed52eac5d6a261ae855aca

commit_message:
Use renamed task files for iscsid

The depends on commit updates the task file names to match the
standalone-roles conventions. This patch updates the
iscsid template to use the updated names.

Depends-On: I64a8541e4388c88d1f3384666eb071c898a9b770

Change-Id: I6eda6cf38a5ec28ab923e5d71b942fc5a2b8039e

subject: Don't force_reconnect() on unhandled Idl exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-24 20:06:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/d36687f4c4edd1791a1ee9a9ffc0f9443a37144f', 'message': "Don't force_reconnect() on unhandled Idl exception

There's no reason to believe that reconnecting to ovsdb-server will
resolve an unhandled exception in python-ovs. In addition, since users
often subclass Idl and add their own notify() methods, there could be
exceptions thrown from that code.

The best we can do is log what is going on and rely on users to fix
the issue. Delaying with sleep() is usually a bad idea since if there
was some kind of ovsdb reconnection, it will delay calls to Idl.run()
which will handle that reconnection over several calls.

Change-Id: Iab2177fb9fa653292a3805689895f98e0833dc4a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-10-24 21:28:54.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/cd70d1e29033f50e23ccd97aacde6cc476baf52e', 'message': "Don't force_reconnect() on unhandled Idl exception

There's no reason to believe that reconnecting to ovsdb-server will
resolve an unhandled exception in python-ovs. In addition, since users
often subclass Idl and add their own notify() methods, there could be
exceptions thrown from that code.

The best we can do is log what is going on and rely on users to fix
the issue. Delaying with sleep() is usually a bad idea since if there
was some kind of ovsdb reconnection, it will delay calls to Idl.run()
which will handle that reconnection over several calls.

Change-Id: Iab2177fb9fa653292a3805689895f98e0833dc4a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force_reconnect() on unhandled Idl exception

There's no reason to believe that reconnecting to ovsdb-server will
resolve an unhandled exception in python-ovs. In addition, since users
often subclass Idl and add their own notify() methods, there could be
exceptions thrown from that code.

The best we can do is log what is going on and rely on users to fix
the issue. Delaying with sleep() is usually a bad idea since if there
was some kind of ovsdb reconnection, it will delay calls to Idl.run()
which will handle that reconnection over several calls.

Change-Id: Iab2177fb9fa653292a3805689895f98e0833dc4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/24/862524/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # in python-ovs, or an unhandled exception in overridden # Idl.notify() code
deleted_lines: # in python-ovs errors += 1 with self.lock: self.idl.force_reconnect() try: idlutils.wait_for_change(self.idl, self.timeout) except Exception as e: # This could throw the same exception as idl.run() # or Exception("timeout"), either way continue LOG.exception(e) sleep = min(2 ** errors, 60) LOG.info("Trying to recover, sleeping %s seconds", sleep) time.sleep(sleep)

commit_message:
Do not disable autocommit until we fully migrate

Some dbapi calls are still relying on it (e.g. touch_conductor
apparently), causing sqlite databases to get locked.

Change-Id: If17d49ef434cf60876a81dae8e5ddaa6dc45e707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/76/862476/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(stephenfin): we need to remove reliance on autocommit semantics ASAP # since it's not compatible with SQLAlchemy 2.0enginefacade.configure(sqlite_fk=True, __autocommit=True)

refactor: update webpack4 to webpack5

1. Update webpack4 to webpack5

5. Update eslint rules
6. Update nodejs version in the package.json
7. Update e2e playbooks to support nodejs with node16

subject: Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for undercloud upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-21 08:52:02.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/undercloud/undercloud-upgrade.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/5fe9dc48f14ea45cc4fe263458a5766ca4578830', 'message': "Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for undercloud upgrade

Dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Dnf module installs
packages which were not installed before the undercloud upgrade.
As a result some packages are installed in step0, and not as it
should be done in step3.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled).

This is the same change that was made for minor update workflow,
but for undercloud upgrade. [1]

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f

Change-Id: I3c24f6c0b1877caca225d532e2c40cabe9095577
(cherry picked from commit 4939e19eebb7ea26462f8eb4b0e1b581adf9f3f3)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for undercloud upgrade

Dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Dnf module installs
packages which were not installed before the undercloud upgrade.
As a result some packages are installed in step0, and not as it
should be done in step3.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled).

This is the same change that was made for minor update workflow,
but for undercloud upgrade. [1]

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f

Change-Id: I3c24f6c0b1877caca225d532e2c40cabe9095577
(cherry picked from commit 4939e19eebb7ea26462f8eb4b0e1b581adf9f3f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/862279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure DNF modules have the right stream enabled tripleo_dnf_stream: name: "{{ item.module }}:{{ item.stream }}" state: enabled
deleted_lines: - name: Ensure DNF modules have the right stream dnf: name: "@{{ item.module }}:{{ item.stream }}/{{ item.profile|default('common') }}" state: present

subject: Implement ratelimiting through haproxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-27 14:53:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/bda73d3587b514e380940366a8ced00293e423f2', 'message': 'Implement ratelimiting through haproxy

In some cases, operators might want to limit rates to API to their
client in order to avoid DDOS of their infrastructure.  By enabling
default rate limiting, all APis would be limited to 5 requests per
seconds calculated over the last 10 seconds.

commit_message:
Implement ratelimiting through haproxy

In some cases, operators might want to limit rates to API to their
client in order to avoid DDOS of their infrastructure.  By enabling
default rate limiting, all APis would be limited to 5 requests per
seconds calculated over the last 10 seconds.

Change-Id: Ibd05a2c8ed935b860fca6afb4c33bdc2bbc3ded1

commit_message:
Bomb out when statsd metrics contain a colon (or newline)

At least some statsd parsers split on colon, leading a metric emission
like

    proxy-server:custom-middleware.some.stat:1|c

to be mis-interpretted as a stat with name "proxy-server", value
"custom-middleware.some.stat", at which point it falls over because
there is no "|".

Seems better to fall over early than send it and hope for the best.

Change-Id: Ie402a7d850e3f87702a3879b511fe56e6a65b1b0

commit_message:
fix supported_distro_check

Without the bool filter, this variable doesn't evaluate properly.

Also changed the msg to use a literal block scalar, the other syntax
while valid was tripping up vim syntax highlighting.

Change-Id: I09afc64f50de4bbbe116d4b116a1fd70d3b91c02

commit_message:
Install rally only on first utility container

Rally should be installed only on first utility container.
We do the same for tempest.

I see no reason of having that installed on all utility containers.
Additionally, because rally does not have serial ['1', '100%'],
python_venv_build may fail due to the venv_wheel_build_skip_check[1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/src/commit/a3b3b7d7aa4751877d7227dec265f1010ce8743e/tasks/main.yml#L44

Change-Id: Ibe79c4fbcaa40b673056b0ef95c7380f9a23f747

commit_message:
Manage CA certificates using ansible

This change introduces a new implementation to manage CA certificate
files by ansible, which replaces the existing one by puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/743620
Change-Id: I241f3d635e36a1497a1146fdd4c1db7dfde28dc8

subject: Fix usage of collections.abc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-10 05:43:42.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/2f709ec501097cd796a6d7e6a88178e930d59aa3', 'message': 'Fix usage of collections.abc

Current logic to try importing the collections.abc module is broken and
the collections module is always imported, which results in deprecation
warning[1].

>>> import collections
>>> c_abc = collections.abc
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/collections/__init__.py", line 55, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError(f'module {__name__!r} has no attribute {name!r}')
AttributeError: module 'collections' has no attribute 'abc'

[1]
DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections'
instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3, and
in 3.10 it will stop working

Note that because Python 2 is no longer supported the logic to use
collcations is just removed.

Change-Id: Id0aeb77a68d556993bece14a71cdccc262c5461b
(cherry picked from commit 881321ddfe48a2653a6c584a677d6989d70993c3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of collections.abc

Current logic to try importing the collections.abc module is broken and
the collections module is always imported, which results in deprecation
warning[1].

>>> import collections
>>> c_abc = collections.abc
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/collections/__init__.py", line 55, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError(f'module {__name__!r} has no attribute {name!r}')
AttributeError: module 'collections' has no attribute 'abc'

[1]
DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections'
instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3, and
in 3.10 it will stop working

Note that because Python 2 is no longer supported the logic to use
collcations is just removed.

Change-Id: Id0aeb77a68d556993bece14a71cdccc262c5461b
(cherry picked from commit 881321ddfe48a2653a6c584a677d6989d70993c3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/06/860806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import abc as collections_abc if isinstance(data, collections_abc.Mapping): if isinstance(data, collections_abc.Iterable):
deleted_lines: try: collectionsAbc = collections.abc except AttributeError: collectionsAbc = collections if isinstance(data, collectionsAbc.Mapping): if isinstance(data, collectionsAbc.Iterable):

commit_message:
Do not enable glance_show_multiple_locations

According to my tests, ``glance_show_multiple_locations`` is not
needed neither for ceph nor horizon's direct image upload.

For safety reasons [1] it's better to keep this option disabled.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0090

Change-Id: I8c36196cd4b35de98cc3c1cabd8c8c2e03ecdae7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/67/862167/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | Default value for ``glance_show_multiple_locations`` has changed to False, regardless of other variables.

commit_message:
Fix prometheus-proxy service name in Red Hat-based distros

The prometheus-proxy service is called octavia-prometheus-proxy in RDO's
RPMs [0].
Add a svc-map for the service name to fix the amphora-agent element for
these distros.

[0] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/octavia-distgit/+/44152

Partial-Bug: 1992668

Change-Id: Ie739cd582103d1aab3021c56654e395b5919358f
(cherry picked from commit 344d6d76ce4481f30fe295114551243d61e7eea8)

ring: Allow RingData to vary dev_id_bytes

Note that the *builder* still doesn't know how to deal with >64k
devices.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/40/862540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The seven LVM volumes in the overcloud-hardened-uefi-full image are now thinly provisioned, backed by a single pool. The initial boot growvols behaviour is now to grow the pool to the size of the disk and grow each thin provisioned volume so the capacity of the pool is filled but not over provisioned. This will allow temporary volumes to be created for backups during upgrades, and it will allow the operator to over-provision a volume which requires extra capacity.

commit_message:
Drop 'source' config key from rabbitmq-server and mysql-innodb-cluster

The infrastructure support charm are sourced from 'distro' and they
don't need to configure an UCA source.

Change-Id: Ia4933529e00be14274dd3ec00d7df1398ec2867f

commit_message:
Re-enable Xena jobs

After a lot of debugging and changes, it appears that with several
tweaks the Xena jobs now are running successfully.

This change uncomments the Xena jobs for both cinder and
compute-kit.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/862440

commit_message:
Deploy placement before nova

With the placement db migrate job removed, we can now deploy
placement ahead of nova. This fixes issues of several nova pods
failing due to placement not being up before nova is.

This change moves the placement service to deploy before nova
in the compute-kit script.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/860975

Change-Id: I62f82224e898761d5b388867c63a259967601d45

commit_message:
Use python3.9 for tips jobs

There's an issue with py37, the tips jobs are failing on stable/yoga.
The official tested runtimes for Yoga are python 3.6 and 3.9, move the
tips jobs to py39

This patch is only for stable/yoga

Change-Id: Ia9e15cdb49253b1a93e1a00a429bf3b4cafc28bf

added_lines: --- features: - | The seven LVM volumes in the overcloud-hardened-uefi-full image are now thinly provisioned, backed by a single pool. The initial boot growvols behaviour is now to grow the pool to the size of the disk and grow each thin provisioned volume so the capacity of the pool is filled but not over provisioned. This will allow temporary volumes to be created for backups during upgrades, and it will allow the operator to over-provision a volume which requires extra capacity.

commit_message:
tripleo_nova_libvirt: make pid ns configurable

Makes the pid namespace configurable for libvirtd containers that use
pid:host. This needs to be configurable for molecule testing when
running podman in podman. Otherwise, pid=host should be used.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ife340f467e5454b588a1c76c8f73858d0c550537

added_lines: ovn charms: default to OVN 22.03 on Focal ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The OVN charms in track 22.03 and later now defaults to install OVN 22.03 for fresh deployments on Focal. Upgrading the charm or adding units to an already deployed application does not trigger the new behavior. A new `ovn-source configuration option`_ has been added, it can be used to override this behavior and trigger payload upgrades. .. _ovn-source configuration option: https://charmhub.io/ovn-chassis/configure?channel=22.03/stable#ovn-source

commit_message:
networking/ovn/hwol: Drop the tech preview caution

We now consider the state of the components listed in the
prerequisites section to be in a good enough shape to no longer
require a tech preview caution for this feature.

Change-Id: I0f5438e22539cf53dda55856a0112cd77b48d219

commit_message:
Clean up ocata and pike branch filters

Since ocata and pike have transitioned to EOL, these filters are not
needed anymore and can be deleted.
This patch also removes some job definition which were only used for
ocata and pike branches.

Change-Id: I69ebf0ae122220ae8c88310094468aedb3f4a660

revisions:

Occasionally rabbitmq replicas fail to come up when running in

commit_message:
Run 1 replica of rabbitmq in the gate

Occasionally rabbitmq replicas fail to come up when running in
zuul due to resource constraints. This causes random failures
and needless rechecks when it comes up.

This change sets the number of replicas when deploying the compute
kit script to 1 from the default 2.

Change-Id: Icdcc075a88d05f87a7f787d306d6b430485964c9

commit_message:
Remove placement db-migrate job

When the placement chart was originally written, there was a
need to migrate from an existing nova-placement setup.

Now that nova and placement have been separated for several
releases, there's not much use in maintaining this job. This
change removes the db-migrate functionality in the placement
chart due to issues with it in newer releases.

The chart version has been bumped to 0.3.0 to signify a
non-trivial change in functionality as well.

Change-Id: I6ff802ab8356deb5e927f414500c52b663cfa30b

commit_message:
k8s: pin juju agent version to 2.9.34

Later versions have issues with healthchecks on the charm container;
pin to .34 which seems to be more reliable.

commit_message:
Remove Ussuri release jobs

This change removes the ussuri-bionic jobs from check in zuul
for openstack-helm. Ussuri is the only release that is still
using bionic images and this change is part of our effort to
stay up-to-date.

A future change will update the charts to remove ussuri overrides
to reflect this.

Change-Id: I18a55426d92654e7baa422ad92ea9f092d854460

commit_message:
CI: Move queue configuration into project-template

With this it can be reused by the other designate repos and we can
reduce the replication everywhere.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

Change-Id: I1fe73145e4a4699939244bc857600efa264f2340
(cherry picked from commit c907cfa1e68249c21e8cad9f58ff3dc3d9cea6df)

commit_message:
Disabling undercloud-tokenflush in catalogue tests

Recently enabled undercloud-tokenflush validation appears unstable.
It will be placed in the skip list until the issue is resolved.

Related-Bug: #1994029

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idcd13dd967562af9eb91720a809a6148e810110d

commit_message:
tripleo_iscsid: update for standalone roles

Renames iscsid_install.yaml to install.yml for consistency with
other roles, adds a configure.yml, and renames iscsid.yaml to run.yml.

Since tripleo-heat-templates was already updated to use this role in
e3408da15cbaa070d8d3725dbdece3183cb928b1, symlinks are added for the old
task file names until tripleo-heat-templates is updated.

Also disables managing the service when in check mode, since the needed
registered result would not be available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/859999
Change-Id: I64a8541e4388c88d1f3384666eb071c898a9b770
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update to python3 packages (suse)

Also doing some light rearranging of packages in general. gcc and
python3-devel are common for all distributions to compile things
during pip installs.

selinux could probably be installed to venvs instead. Not sure about
policycoreutils.

Change-Id: Ie6983ec698441e18edad62b3ef8fd8e5b6db21e3

subject: Allow passing aditional arguments to wsrep_provider_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-14 05:26:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/284787f4996ab3cdb69e78bc94ecbf2c82fd4bbc', 'message': "Allow passing aditional arguments to wsrep_provider_options

This commit allows to inject arbitrary arguments into the
wsrep_provider_options string.
Operators should be extremely careful in doing so as there is no
validation or syntax checking whatsoever.

Example:

ExtraConfig:
  tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::provider_options: 'evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S'

results in:

wsrep_provider_options = evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S;gcache.recover=no;gmcast.listen_addr=tcp://172.17.0.151:4567;socket.ssl_key=/etc/pki/tls/private/mysql.key;socket.ssl_cert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/mysql.crt;socket.ssl_cipher=AES128-SHA256;socket.ssl_ca=/etc/ipa/ca.crt;

Change-Id: Ie4711ace66846b10252bccdddae84e045af3f604
(cherry picked from commit 171814ebbab2db3d1554d580f48fb92f95617e3a)

commit_message:
Allow passing aditional arguments to wsrep_provider_options

This commit allows to inject arbitrary arguments into the
wsrep_provider_options string.
Operators should be extremely careful in doing so as there is no
validation or syntax checking whatsoever.

Example:

ExtraConfig:
  tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::provider_options: 'evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S'

results in:

wsrep_provider_options = evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S;gcache.recover=no;gmcast.listen_addr=tcp://172.17.0.151:4567;socket.ssl_key=/etc/pki/tls/private/mysql.key;socket.ssl_cert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/mysql.crt;socket.ssl_cipher=AES128-SHA256;socket.ssl_ca=/etc/ipa/ca.crt;

Change-Id: Ie4711ace66846b10252bccdddae84e045af3f604
(cherry picked from commit 171814ebbab2db3d1554d580f48fb92f95617e3a)

commit_message:
Clean up some replication error messages

Lines like `Invalid response 500 from ::1` aren't terribly useful in an
all-in-one, while lines like

   Error syncing with node: {'device': 'd5', 'id': 3, 'ip': '::1',
   'meta': '', 'port': 6200, 'region': 1, 'replication_ip': '::1',
   'replication_port': 6200, 'weight': 8000.0, 'zone': 1, 'index': 0}:
   Timeout (60s)

are needlessly verbose.

While we're at it, introduce a node_to_string() helper, and use it in a
bunch of places.

Change-Id: I62b12f69e9ac44ce27ffaed320c0a3563673a018

commit_message:
Retargetting log removal task

Existing log dir removal task, added with Ia4e2fbbbd02d66522fc5f92441f9b6d3c0ebd840
was targetting wrong directory, essentially becoming useless.
With this change the location will be cleaned up
before execution of the tests as intened.

Closes-Bug: #1993262

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic2130702ca459b62a82682c7e85b89359ac6dcbe

commit_message:
Sets higher values for timeouts

 - corosync token_timeout: 30000
 - puppet pacemaker: evs.suspect_timeout=PT30S

These higher values are an attempt to avoid
slower operations hitting errors on overcloud
deployments in OVB jobs.

Related-Bug: #1987092
Change-Id: Idd8170e435335566e9d1114675259d4d8d603364
(cherry picked from commit eb57ba758b69ca95650ea18d5846f28397411936)

commit_message:
Add reqs2pkg

This tool reads in one or more python requirements files and generates
a list of distribution specific package names  the intent is to use it
something like:

  sudo ${package_manager} install $(deps2pkg -r requirements.txt -b)
  sudo pip install .

To install a python project that runs against the distribution provided
pagages rather than pypi wheels/dists

Change-Id: Icd0720311e7863190b84aa916f13e7efa830a4eb

commit_message:
Restore use of addresses in ovsdb-cms interface

The OVS python module cannot use hostnames for OVS DB connection
strings; resync ovsdb library and pickup revised version of
ops-openstack to restore use of IP addresses instead.

Depends-On: Iefe8ad601b305e3fdab7548e1d3357493491d3e9
Change-Id: I8e9465a8c1915ffc7e54510e9961d5f386559533

commit_message:
Lock down stable/1.8 branch for stable builds

- set git defaultbranch in .gitreview
- update requirements to point to @stable/zed branches for
  charm-helpers, charms.openstack, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests
- keep only jammy bundles (this is for long term testing of the 1.8
  branch).

commit_message:
zuul: Declare queue at top level

Zuul deprecated declaring shared queues at a pipeline level with
release 4.1.0[1]. This updates the job definition to use the top level
declaration instead.

See [2] for details.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html

Change-Id: Ie63dd3b161cb8fd9be89002027d699ce2c4a67a5
(cherry picked from commit 4212950a4a6b036f563a236cb005604e1c096f04)

commit_message:
Restore use of address on OVN interfaces

Some clients can't use hostnames yet so expose both address and
hostname information on the ovsdb{-cms} interface type.

This supports backwards compatibility with the existing reactive
interfaces as well.

Change-Id: Iefe8ad601b305e3fdab7548e1d3357493491d3e9

commit_message:
support tripleo_etcd ansible role

This patch removes the tripleo-heat-templates dependency on puppet
for etcd configuration (i.e, t-h-t-> puppet-tripleo-> puppet-etcd) and
ensures that t-h-t relies on the new ansible role tripleo_etcd.

puppet etcd hiera data generation code is removed and ansible vars are
passed to the role directly.

puppet_config section is no longer needed.

Depends-On: Ia3cf58512c35cd1c2501c606df6fc0f4e4438120
Change-Id: Ic12715f17e831cb5e1ac8993408f85adcd01a312
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/44/849844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The default value "new" needs to be overridden only when an overcloud node is replaced, at which time the value should be set to "existing". type: string default: 'new' constraints: - allowed_values: ['new', 'existing'] MonitoringSubscriptionEtcd: default: 'overcloud-etcd' type: string EnableInternalTLS: type: boolean default: false EnableEtcdInternalTLS: description: Controls whether etcd and the cinder-volume service use TLS for cinder's lock manager, even when the rest of the internal API network is using TLS. type: boolean default: true InternalTLSCAFile: default: '/etc/ipa/ca.crt' type: string description: Specifies the default CA cert to use if TLS is used for services in the internal network. ETCD_NAME=$(hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml etcd::etcd_name) if ! grep -q $ETCD_NAME /tmp/etcd-members; then echo "This is a new node that is unable to manage etcd membership" exit 0 fi # Remove old members. These are nodes in the current list of members # that are *not* in the ETCD_INITIAL_CLUSTER. while read id status name peers clients; do \ if [[ "${ETCD_INITIAL_CLUSTER}" != *"${name}=${peers}"* ]]; then echo "Removing old member ${name} (ID ${id}) from the cluster" eval $ETCDCTL member remove ${id} fi done < /tmp/etcd-members # Add new members. These are nodes in the ETCD_INITIAL_CLUSTER that are # not in the list of current members. ETCD_INITIAL_CLUSTER is a comma # delimited list of "name=peers" tuples, so iterate over the list. IFS=, ETCD_MEMBERS=(${ETCD_INITIAL_CLUSTER}) for member in ${ETCD_MEMBERS[@]}; do \ # Split the tuple IFS='=' read name peers <<< $member if ! grep -q "${name} ${peers}" /tmp/etcd-members; then echo "Adding new member ${name} to the cluster" eval $ETCDCTL member add ${name} --peer-urls=${peers} fi done params: TLS_OPTS: if: - internal_tls_enabled - str_replace: template: "--cacert=TLS_CA --cert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/etcd.crt --key=/etc/pki/tls/private/etcd.key" params: TLS_CA: {get_param: InternalTLSCAFile} - "" docker_config: step_2: etcd: image: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, ContainerEtcdImage]} net: host privileged: false restart: always healthcheck: test: /openstack/healthcheck volumes: list_concat: - commit_message:
Release heat for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to heat since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 16.0.0..5a6bff198
5a6bff198 Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing
d05b683ef Use constraints when creating tempest venv
bc4e3bb62 Use previous parameter merge strategy
4b20eeff4 Use f36 instead of f33 for testing
aa31864de Fix None comparision when sorting by `updated_at`
69699b2d0 Provide install_command to pip install with upper-constraints
6002015fe Fix timeout calc of nested resource groups
a5e713b62 Reproduce bug story/2009237
621191321 Fallback to upstream for Fedora image
ead402253 Make grenade job voting again
73150f220 Detect EL8 platform-python
8fbd4476c Use Block Storage API v3 instead of API v2
7b9ffc5be Preserve order in list_concat_unique
7af71497e Don't update status for replaced resource
0bffa5c2e Assume interface detach called for port not found
2b4258789 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
5d69a135f Update .gitreview for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I3dd52a2a7389997c77b7977f4d5ae9a96aba3fc2

commit_message:
In nova_cc_utils.py:resolve_hosts_for: .append -> .add

The method was refactored (in part) to use sets to enforce uniqueness of
the hosts.  Unfortunately, a list method (.append()) slipped through
that should have been converted to .add(). This fixes that error.

Change-Id: I248430cd1a9156efab745fe110a39441b503b3a5
Closes-Bug: #1992789

commit_message:
Ensure upgrades are executed

Prior to this change, big bang upgrades were not being run
when openstack-origin was updated to a new release.

Closes-Bug: #1979553
Change-Id: I5cda72d55b7aba51d087bababa94435e53c2201b
(cherry picked from commit e237d6621eec7734a18dae52618030c30a21c9b8)

commit_message:
Add read-only proxy for database connection

This proposal is to document a read-only haproxy configuration that can
be used by OpenStack services to lower the load on the master db
backend.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I6cf86c97ce1f2dd86d5da7c4e07384ae739ed10b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/large-scale refs/changes/71/862471/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: You will need to run a reverse proxy in front of your galera cluster to ensure OpenStack only ever communicates with a single cluster node for ``write`` requests. This is required because OpenStack do not handle well the deadlocks when writing to different nodes in parallel. timeout client 300s listen db_master bind 0.0.0.0:3306 balance first option mysql-check server server-1 server-1.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster id 1 server server-2 server-2.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup id 2 server server-3 server-3.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup id 3 listen db_slave bind 0.0.0.0:3308 balance first option mysql-check server server-1 server-1.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup id 3 server server-2 server-2.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster id 1 server server-3 server-3.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup id 2 By using two blocks, we can separate the ``read`` only SQL requests (listening on port 3308 here) from ``read/write`` requests (listening on port 3306 here) and lower down a little bit the load on the first (master) mysql backend. connection = mysql+pymysql://login:pass@proxy:3306/db?charset=utf8 slave_connection = mysql+pymysql://login:pass@proxy:3308/db?charset=utf8The ``connection`` is used by OpenStack services to do ``read`` and ``write`` requests. The ``slave_connection`` is used by OpenStack services to do ``read`` only requests.
deleted_lines: You will need to run a reverse proxy in front of your galera cluster to ensure OpenStack only ever communicates with a single cluster node. This is required because OpenStack can not handle the potential consistency issues that arrise when writing to different nodes in parallel. timeout client 300s listen mysql bind 0.0.0.0:3306 option mysql-check server server-1 server-1.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup server server-2 server-2.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup server server-3 server-3.with.the.fqdn check inter 5s downinter 15s fastinter 2s resolvers cluster backup Entering all servers with ``backup`` at the end ensures that haproxy will always choose the first server unless it is offline.

commit_message:
Rework the journey indexing

This patch propose a rework of the toctree so we have all configure
resources available in a subfolder instead of only one page.

This is also solving the issue introduced in 862100 (duplicate menu
entry).

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I9b45309a981d0f0ddedc006b90499036b137360b

commit_message:
Remove reference to 'all-plugin' tox environment

The 'all-plugin' tox environment was deprecated by this patch [1].
Instead of the 'all-plugin' it is recommended to use the 'all' tox
environment.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/543974

Change-Id: I8981592bf8c4e812c72b446e9d9fdeaaaa8c4537

commit_message:
Move configuration guidelines

Move configuration guidelines under configure section instead of others.
The purpose behind this is to add some other configure/ pages (like one
for the database, neutron, nova, etc).

The fact that they were in Other resources was confusing to me.

Also separate resources from this SIG with external resources (links to
external websites).

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: Ifc1fba679bf5a816cd60b5aa3ae5a60ccf6c2492

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-07 19:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project-templates.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/1b1174d2869b5406f0bf4b44beab08a74a00766c', 'message': 'Remove distro zuul jobs except for ubuntu focal.

Focal is the only remaining operating system which supports the
distro deployment method for the Zed release [1], remove jobs running
on other operating systems to reduce CI load and improve
chances of jobs passing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/latest/admin/upgrades/compatibility-matrix.html

Change-Id: I06bf300c369c4288fe2c09e15959ee2e69b42475
'}]
commit_message:
Remove distro zuul jobs except for ubuntu focal.

Focal is the only remaining operating system which supports the
distro deployment method for the Zed release [1], remove jobs running
on other operating systems to reduce CI load and improve
chances of jobs passing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/latest/admin/upgrades/compatibility-matrix.html

Change-Id: I06bf300c369c4288fe2c09e15959ee2e69b42475

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I92990bd9aa48941e092fafc6246317e152ad4602

commit_message:
Handle empty image_type in launch-instance workflow

Fix the getImageType function to handle edge case
when image_type attribute is present but is an
empty string.

Closes-Bug: 1993579

commit_message:
Updates for zed stable branch creation

- Set default branch for git review/gerrit to stable/zed
- Switch tests to stable.
- Switch to using stable charm-helpers branch.
- Switch to using stable charm.openstack branch.
- Switch to using stable zaza, zaza-openstack-tests
  branch
- (reactive charms) Add build.lock file
- (classic charms) make sync
- (reactive: not reactive plugin): lock charm-tools < 3.1

is only the ussuri release jobs. This is part of the effort to
cleanup older releases and distros.

subject: libvirt: stop using connection_info for NFS file format
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-22 00:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/nfs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_nfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/38bd5b2368deede5d395702849b370f27e840883', 'message': "libvirt: stop using connection_info for NFS file format

Currently, we use connection_info to obtain the file format when
generating guest XML for volume disks. This usually works fine but in
the case of NFS, if the attached volume is later snapshotted, we will
generate XML with incorrect <driver type='raw'> upon the next boot
of the instance.

This happens because cinder returns the volume format in attachment
connection_info, not the snapshot format, because attachment records
are associated with the volume and not the snapshot.

One way to handle this is to stop using connection_info format in the
NFS volume driver and instead read the format from the source file with
qemu-img info.

Closes-Bug: #1989514

"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: stop using connection_info for NFS file format

Currently, we use connection_info to obtain the file format when
generating guest XML for volume disks. This usually works fine but in
the case of NFS, if the attached volume is later snapshotted, we will
generate XML with incorrect <driver type='raw'> upon the next boot
of the instance.

This happens because cinder returns the volume format in attachment
connection_info, not the snapshot format, because attachment records
are associated with the volume and not the snapshot.

One way to handle this is to stop using connection_info format in the
NFS volume driver and instead read the format from the source file with
qemu-img info.

Closes-Bug: #1989514

Change-Id: I3c72fffb6125612067099e6e85143bbcd86dd0a0

commit_message:
Add chroot support to tripleo-mount-image

This change adds support for immediately starting a chroot when an
image has been mounted.

This is convenient since many uses of tripleo-mount-image will require
running commands inside the image (such as dnf install). Starting a
useful chroot is slightly involved since it requires bind-mounting
/dev and copying in /etc/resolve.conf. This change handles that, as
well as cleanup and automatic unmount on exit.

This change also makes the -m <directory> command optional, when not
specified a temp directory will be created and used as the mount
directory.

Change-Id: I533ce13833bbfaab0ede3a11b6c22e45fe767939
(cherry picked from commit f4b3ff3c40fac32f395b83a6c753ff8f7d2ded8b
                and commit 0366b14d0b540500fb2051a39962717e44df3038)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/39/855839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHROOT="" echo " --chroot -- Start a working chroot which is active until exit." echo " Directory will be unmounted on chroot exit"start_chroot () { EACTION="echo Exited chroot, unmounting $MOUNT_DIR ; unmount_image" trap "$EACTION" EXIT mount -o bind /dev $MOUNT_DIR/dev/ EACTION="umount $MOUNT_DIR/dev/; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT if [ -a $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf ]; then mv $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf.tmi EACTION="mv $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf.tmi $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT fi cp /etc/resolv.conf $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf EACTION="rm $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT echo "Starting chroot in $MOUNT_DIR, exit will also unmount" PS1="[\u@chroot \W]\$ " chroot $MOUNT_DIR /bin/bash -l } TEMP=`getopt -o ha:m:n: -l help,chroot -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@"` --chroot) CHROOT=yes ; shift;; if [ -z "${MOUNT_DIR}" ]; then MOUNT_DIR=$(mktemp -d) fi if [ -z "${IMAGE_FILE}" ]; then if [ -n $CHROOT ]; then start_chroot fi

subject: Support multiple mounts without explicit nbd devices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-05 01:06:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/b433913b17bc40b290de56263833ad7fc0dcb4fc', 'message': "Support multiple mounts without explicit nbd devices

Currently the default nbd device is /dev/nbd0, so mounting and
unmounting one image works without specifying a -n argument.

However mounting multiple images requires an explicit correct -n
/dev/nbdX for both tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
calls, which gets difficult to manage.

This change fixes that by choosing an appropriate NBD device in each
case. For mount, the lsblk PTTYPE is set for devices in use, so
iterate the devices until a free one is found. For unmount, look at
the 'mount -l' output and trace the root mount path back to the NBD
device which is in use.

Change-Id: I1f221f3fb4dd70c919168d52c53e03c3b2535c04

commit_message:
Support multiple mounts without explicit nbd devices

Currently the default nbd device is /dev/nbd0, so mounting and
unmounting one image works without specifying a -n argument.

However mounting multiple images requires an explicit correct -n
/dev/nbdX for both tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
calls, which gets difficult to manage.

This change fixes that by choosing an appropriate NBD device in each
case. For mount, the lsblk PTTYPE is set for devices in use, so
iterate the devices until a free one is found. For unmount, look at
the 'mount -l' output and trace the root mount path back to the NBD
device which is in use.

Change-Id: I1f221f3fb4dd70c919168d52c53e03c3b2535c04
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/852068
(cherry picked from commit 6334593e4aad813d454b2eb44385d34f1fe32dbd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/37/855837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NBD_DEVICE=""if [ ! -a "/dev/nbd0" ]; then echo " -n <nbd device> -- NBD device to use (example, /dev/nbd0)." echo " Defaults to first available" echo " -n <nbd device> -- NBD device to disconnect (example, /dev/nbd0)." echo " Defaults to detected device from mounted directory" set +e devices=$(ls ${NBD_DEVICE}p*) set -e MOUNT_DIR=$(realpath ${MOUNT_DIR}) if [ -z "${NBD_DEVICE}" ]; then for i in {0..15} ; do device="/dev/nbd${i}" mountpoints=$(lsblk --noheadings --output MOUNTPOINT $device) if [[ $mountpoints =~ "$MOUNT_DIR" ]]; then NBD_DEVICE="$device" break fi done fi if [ -z "${NBD_DEVICE}" ]; then echo "NBD device could not be detected from existing mounts." echo "Specify a device with -n if an unmount is really required" exit 1 fi MOUNT_DIR=$(realpath ${MOUNT_DIR}) if mountpoint "${MOUNT_DIR}"; then echo "${MOUNT_DIR} is already a mountpoint, unmount it or specify a different path" mount_show_options 1 fi if [ -z "${NBD_DEVICE}" ]; then for i in {0..15} ; do device="/dev/nbd${i}" part_type=$(lsblk --nodeps --noheadings --output PTTYPE $device) if [ -z "${part_type}" ]; then NBD_DEVICE="$device" break fi done if [ -z "${NBD_DEVICE}" ]; then echo "No NBD device is available" exit 1 fi fi
deleted_lines: NBD_DEVICE=/dev/nbd0if [ ! -a "${NBD_DEVICE}" ]; then echo " -n <nbd device> -- NBD device to use." echo " Defaults to /dev/nbd0" echo " -n <nbd device> -- NBD device to disconnect." echo " Defaults to /dev/nbd0" devices=$(ls -1 ${NBD_DEVICE}p*)

commit_message:
Support standard partition type GUIDs

This change adds GUID detection for mounting /boot and /boot/efi.

Closes-Bug: #1983467
Change-Id: I0c1b6670fa57e61748f9d890db1173ad442f6680
(cherry picked from commit e6b0a7bf34e5b15f32de9ed51bf914f990ee585a)

commit_message:
Capture storage setup

This change adds a few items to review storage setups in integration
and litmus jobs.

- device mounts (for swift)
- loopback devices (for cinder, manila and swift)
- lvm (for cinder and manila)

Change-Id: I65525f13b31b5041e3b0b7b4b818ec6c5cfc7e6b

commit_message:
Adds regression test for bug LP#1944619

Related-bug: #1944619
Closes-bug: #1964472
Change-Id: Ie7e5377aea23a4fbd7ad91f245d17def6d0fb927
(cherry picked from commit 2ddb8bf53fdf9a17c09afc4987ab6efe8ba97696)
(cherry picked from commit 3402aa7a53a48e6abc0fb8a2620cd449fd3f75fe)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/862401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2021, Canonical, Inc. All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from nova import exception as nova_exceptions from nova.tests.fixtures import libvirt as fakelibvirt from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.functional.libvirt import base class TestRollbackWithHWOffloadedOVS( base.LibvirtMigrationMixin, base.ServersTestBase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin ): """Regression test for bug LP#1944619 Assert the behaviour observed in bug LP#1944619 caused by the live migration cleanup code being used to cleanup pre-live migration failures. When SRIOV devices are in use on a VM, that will cause the source host to try to re-attach a VIF not actually de-attached causing a failure. The exception mocked in pre_live_migration reproduce an arbitrary error that might cause the pre-live migration process to fail and rollback_live_migration_at_source reproduce the device re-attach failure. """ api_major_version = 'v2.1' microversion = 'latest' ADMIN_API = True def setUp(self): super().setUp() self.start_compute( hostname='src', host_info=fakelibvirt.HostInfo( cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=4, cpu_threads=1)) self.start_compute( hostname='dest', host_info=fakelibvirt.HostInfo( cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=4, cpu_threads=1)) self.src = self.computes['src'] self.dest = self.computes['dest'] def test_rollback_pre_live_migration(self): self.server = self._create_server(host='src', networks='none') lib_path = "nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver" funtion_path = "pre_live_migration" mock_lib_path_prelive = "%s.%s" % (lib_path, funtion_path) with mock.patch(mock_lib_path_prelive, side_effect=nova_exceptions.DestinationDiskExists( path='/var/non/existent')) as mlpp: funtion_path = "rollback_live_migration_at_source" mock_lib_path_rollback = "%s.%s" % (lib_path, funtion_path) with mock.patch(mock_lib_path_rollback) as mlpr: # Live migrate the instance to another host self._live_migrate(self.server, migration_expected_state='failed', server_expected_state='MIGRATING') # FIXME(erlon): In the current behavior, # rollback_live_migration_at_source is called if an error happens # during the pre_live_migration phase on the destination and therefore # triggers the observed bug. rollback_live_migration_at_source should # *not* be called for when errors happen during pre_live_migration # phase. mlpr.assert_called_once() mlpp.assert_called_once()

commit_message:
Add conceptual content on images and volumes

Change-Id: I6a3c3c435ebcf066ab6d4cfee6064f6bee32e70b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/77/860977/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========== Nova images =========== In order for this overview to be complete, some purely upstream OpenStack information is also included. Glance ------ Local storage Glance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A cloud image import will result in the image being stored on the Glance machine's local filesystem under ``/var/lib/glance/images``: .. code-block:: none IMAGE_URL=http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/focal/current/focal-server-cloudimg-amd64.img curl $IMAGE_URL | openstack image create --public --container-format bare \ --disk-format qcow2 --property architecture=x86_64 \ --property hw_disk_bus=virtio --property hw_vif_model=virtio \ focal-amd64 This can be inspected (assuming a glance unit of ``glance/0``): .. code-block:: none openstack image list +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------+ | ID | Name | Status | +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------+ | c6d9fa71-c4a2-44b6-8b38-b012623a4969 | focal-amd64 | active | +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------+ juju ssh glance/0 sudo ls -lh /var/lib/glance/images -rw-r----- 1 glance glance 519M Jul 17 18:05 c6d9fa71-c4a2-44b6-8b38-b012623a4969 Swift-backed Glance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Swift-backed Glance is achieved with the addition of a relation to the swift-proxy application: .. code-block:: none juju add-relation glance swift-proxy Ceph-backed Glance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Ceph-backed Glance is achieved with the addition of a relation to the ceph-mon application: .. code-block:: none juju add-relation glance:ceph ceph-mon:client A 'glance' Ceph pool will be created that will store images. Ideally, when importing an image into Ceph-backed Glance the image should be imported as 'raw': .. code-block:: none openstack image create --public --container-format bare --disk-format raw \ --property architecture=x86_64 --property hw_disk_bus=virtio \ --property hw_vif_model=virtio --file focal-amd64.img \ focal-amd64 Image import with Ceph-backed Glance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This scenario will result in a "Ceph RBD Glance image". Nova ---- Instance creation with Nova ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A VM's root image will be stored local to its hypervisor unless: 1. the nova-compute charm option ``libvirt-image-backend`` is set to 'rbd' (demands that Ceph-backed Nova be enabled) OR 2. a Cinder root image is used Values for ``libvirt-image-backend`` are: 'rbd', 'qcow2', 'raw', 'flat', or NULL The default value is 'qcow2', and the values 'raw' and 'flat' yield identical results. The ``libvirt-image-backend`` option affects both root disks and ephemeral disks defined in OpenStack flavors (see section 'Flavors with ephemeral disks'). It can be set post-deploy (of nova-compute) like this: .. code-block:: none juju config nova-compute libvirt-image-backend=rbd|qcow2|raw|flat openstack server create --image focal-amd64 --flavor m1.micro --key-name admin-key --network=$NET_ID focal-1 .. code-block:: none openstack server list +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------------------------------+-------------+----------+ | ID | Name | Status | Networks | Image | Flavor | +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------------------------------+-------------+----------+ | db94ebbc-688d-410d-9933-1d9f2a8c09da | focal-1 | ACTIVE | int_net=192.168.0.38, 10.246.116.6 | focal-amd64 | m1.micro | +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------------------------------+-------------+----------+ .. code-block:: none juju ssh nova-compute/0 sudo ls -lh /var/lib/nova/instances/db94ebbc-688d-410d-9933-1d9f2a8c09da total 46M -rw------- 1 root root 82K Jul 17 18:27 console.log -rw-r--r-- 1 libvirt-qemu kvm 46M Jul 17 18:29 disk -rw-r--r-- 1 nova nova 79 Jul 17 18:25 disk.info The theoretical/maximum size of a Nova disk is determined by the flavor chosen during instance-creation. Ceph-backed Nova ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Ceph-backed Nova is achieved with: .. code-block:: none juju add-relation ceph-mon:client nova-compute:ceph To have any effect, the `libvirt-image-backend` must be set to 'rbd'. .. note:: Changing the above option's value will orphan any VM disks that were set up under the previous setting. This will lead to a broken instance the next time it is restarted. Instance creation with Ceph-backed Nova ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This scenario will result in a Ceph-based root disk. Ceph-backed Nova + ``libvirt-image-backend=rbd`` will give "Ceph RBD Nova disks" for root disks. .. note:: Attempting ``libvirt-image-backend=rbd`` without the ceph-mon/nova-compute relation will cause instance-creation to error out. Cinder ------ The term "volume" refers specifically to a Cinder disk. There is no analogous term for a Nova disk. Cinder volumes can be used as instance root disks in two ways: 1. from a dynamically-created volume .. code-block:: none openstack server create --image focal-amd64-raw --flavor m1.micro \ --boot-from-volume 5 --key-name admin-key --nic net-id=$NET_ID \ focal-dcvol 2. from a pre-created volume .. code-block:: none openstack volume create --image focal-amd64-raw --size 5 focal-amd64-5G openstack server create --flavor m1.micro --volume focal-amd64-5G --key-name admin-key --nic net-id=$NET_ID focal-pcvol If a volume method is used (``--boot-from-volume`` or ``--volume``) then Cinder volumes will take precedence over a possible Nova disk. Ensure that a raw image is used for the root disk: .. code-block:: none openstack image create --public --container-format bare --disk-format raw \ --file ~/cloud-images/focal-amd64.raw \ focal-amd64-raw The theoretical/maximum size of a Cinder volume is determined by the size stated during volume-creation (``--size``) or during instance-creation (``--boot-from-volume``). By default, Cinder volumes will persist after an instance is destroyed. Ceph-backed Cinder ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Ceph-backed Cinder is achieved with: .. code-block:: none juju deploy cinder-ceph juju add-relation cinder-ceph:ceph ceph-mon:client juju add-relation cinder-ceph:storage-backend cinder:storage-backend juju add-relation cinder-ceph:ceph-access nova-compute:ceph-access A 'cinder-ceph' Ceph pool will be created that will store volumes. Instance creation with Ceph-backed Cinder ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This scenario in conjunction with either of the two volume methods will result in "Ceph RBD Cinder volumes" for root disks. This is effectively the same as the Ceph-backed Nova case ("Ceph RBD Nova disks") yet achieved via different code paths. Non local instance root disks ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ In summary, the following two scenarios will avoid hypervisor-local root disks: 1. Cinder a) have Cinder enabled (natively or Ceph-backed) b) stipulate to have the instance boot from a volume at instance-creation time (`--boot-from-volume` or `--volume`) 2. Nova a) have Ceph-backed Nova b) stipulate an RBD image backend (``libvirt-image-backend=rbd``) Attaching secondary Cinder volumes ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Create a Cinder volume and attach it to a VM: .. code-block:: none openstack volume create --size 5 5G openstack server add volume focal-1 5G Flavors with ephemeral disks ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ An OpenStack flavor with an ephemeral disk: .. code-block:: none openstack flavor create --public \ --ram 256 --disk 4 --ephemeral 4 --vcpus 1 \ m1.micro The ephemeral disk is a Nova disk that is influenced, as usual, by the ``libvirt-image-backend`` nova-compute charm option. If this value is 'rbd' then the ephemeral disk will be Ceph-based and if the value is anything else the ephemeral disk will be hypervisor-local. The above is true irrespective of whether a Cinder boot volume is used. NOT SURE ABOUT THIS The ephemeral disk will be auto-mounted in the instance. Secondary volumes with Ceph-backed Cinder ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This scenario will result in "Ceph RBD Cinder volumes". TODO: Ephemeral disks Ceph pools: * 'nova' : used for "Ceph RBD Nova disks" * 'cinder-ceph' : used for "Ceph RBD Cinder volumes" * 'glance' : used for "Ceph RBD Glance images" juju ssh ceph-mon/0 sudo rbd ls -l --pool nova NAME SIZE PARENT FMT PROT LOCK f7b2b678-1c87-40d8-85db-7653bfaad60a_disk 4 GiB 2 excl f7b2b678-1c87-40d8-85db-7653bfaad60a_disk.eph0 4 GiB 2 excl juju ssh ceph-mon/0 sudo rbd ls -l --pool cinder-ceph NAME SIZE PARENT FMT PROT LOCK volume-5e2d9a70-7256-44b6-8246-2aa12be45f1b 4 GiB glance/e1fa159d-5dee-456c-ae6e-cc155c46c1f7@snap 2 volume-9acab1b8-dfb8-47f9-9f10-0b7fd6d902ae 4 GiB glance/e1fa159d-5dee-456c-ae6e-cc155c46c1f7@snap 2 There was an evolution of the meaning of the term "ephemeral". It was originally attributed to a boot disk that went up in smoke upon instance shutdown. When that ceased being the case the term was attributed to any disk that was not managed outside of Nova, because although a disk is now harder to lose it is not quite considered safe. That's why we see it being contrasted to shared storage like Ceph and Cinder that have more resiliency to data loss. An OpenStack flavor's '--ephemeral' disk option ruins this bearable situation by implying that the boot disk is never considered ephemeral (this may be defensible by saying that the flavor's ephemeral disk is not subject to snapshots). The main issue to me, in the use of the term "ephemeral", is the subjective nature involved in deciding whether a disk is considered "easy to lose" or not. .. code-block:: none openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.74 server create --flavor m1.micro \ --volume focal-amd64-5G --key-name admin-key --network int_net \ --host node1.maas \ focal-vol curl http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/focal/current/focal-server-cloudimg-amd64.img --output ~/cloud-images/focal-amd64.img qemu-img convert -f qcow2 -O raw ~/cloud-images/focal-amd64.img ~/cloud-images/focal-amd64.raw openstack image create --public --container-format bare --disk-format raw --file ~/cloud-images/focal-amd64.raw focal-amd64-raw openstack volume create --image focal-amd64-raw --size 10 focal-amd64-raw-10G

commit_message:
Auto-detect partition types for mounting more images

This change replaces the behaviour which makes assumptions about the
partition layout based simply on how many partitions there are.

Instead, attributes of the block device are used to infer whether the
partition is a boot, EFI, or root device.

This change is required to mount the RHEL-9 image, which is a
whole-disk image that has boot, EFI, and root partitions.

Images known to correctly mount with this change include:
overcloud-full.qcow2
overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2
CentOS-Stream-GenericCloud-8-20210603.0.x86_64.qcow2
CentOS-Stream-GenericCloud-9-20220127.0.x86_64.qcow2
rhel-guest-image-9.0-20220125.3.x86_64.qcow2
openSUSE-Leap-15.3.x86_64-NoCloud.qcow2
bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.img
bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs
debian-10-openstack-amd64.qcow2

A similar approach may be attempted to add rhel-9 support to
diskimage-builder extract-image.

This change also fixes an incorrect check path in the remove_device
function.

Change-Id: I4397a660e874ff351f5da697ddc504e0f2c8cf5a
(cherry picked from commit 82a80c72ede026e643d16372b5e4eb89354ba586)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/36/855836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -b "$1" ]; then root_device="" boot_device="" efi_device="" # wait for any sub-devices to appear timeout 5 sh -c "while ! ls ${NBD_DEVICE}p* ; do sleep 1; done" || true devices=$(ls -1 ${NBD_DEVICE}p*) device_count=$(echo $devices | wc -w) if [ $device_count == "0" ]; then # if there are no partition devices, assume one root device root_device=${NBD_DEVICE} elif [ $device_count == "1" ]; then # if there is one partition device, assume it is the root device root_device=${devices} devices="" fi for device in ${devices}; do lsblk --nodeps -P --output-all $device label=$(lsblk --nodeps --noheadings --output LABEL $device) part_type_name=$(lsblk --nodeps --noheadings --output PARTTYPENAME $device) part_label=$(lsblk --nodeps --noheadings --output PARTLABEL $device) if [[ ${part_type_name} == "BIOS boot" ]] || [[ ${part_type_name} == "PowerPC PReP boot" ]]; then # Ignore unmountable partition continue fi # look for EFI partition to mount at /boot/efi if [ -z "$efi_device" ]; then if [[ ${part_type_name} == "EFI System" ]]; then efi_device=$device continue fi fi # look for partition to mount as /boot, only the RHEL guest image is known # to have this if [ -z "$boot_device" ]; then if [[ ${label} == "boot" ]]; then boot_device=$device continue fi fi if [ -z "$root_device" ]; then root_device=$device continue fi done if [ -z "$root_device" ]; then echo "ERROR: No root device found to mount" exit 1 else # a simple root partition mount $root_device $MOUNT_DIR fi if [ ! -z "$boot_device" ]; then # mount to /boot mount $boot_device $MOUNT_DIR/boot fi if [ ! -z "$efi_device" ]; then # mount to /boot/efi mount $efi_device $MOUNT_DIR/boot/efi unmount_volume $MOUNT_DIR/boot
deleted_lines: if [ -b "/dev/mapper/$1" ]; then if [ -b "${NBD_DEVICE}p3" ]; then # 3 partitions in the image, so assume the first 2 are boot partitions # a whole-disk overcloud with a single root partition # for example, overcloud-hardened-full.qcow2 mount ${NBD_DEVICE}p3 $MOUNT_DIR # the EFI partition may be the first or second, try both if blkid -t PARTLABEL="ESP" ${NBD_DEVICE}p1 ; then mount ${NBD_DEVICE}p1 $MOUNT_DIR/boot/efi elif blkid -t PARTLABEL="ESP" ${NBD_DEVICE}p2 ; then mount ${NBD_DEVICE}p2 $MOUNT_DIR/boot/efi fi else # a partition image # for example, overcloud-full.qcow2 if [ -b "${NBD_DEVICE}p1" ]; then mount ${NBD_DEVICE}p1 $MOUNT_DIR else mount ${NBD_DEVICE} $MOUNT_DIR fi

subject: Choose version of Ansible OpenStack collection based on RDO release
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-17 09:01:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/f4cadb94b7349f46ba343382918d0099c45d84ce', 'message': "Choose version of Ansible OpenStack collection based on RDO release

Starting with RDO Zed, openstacksdk has been bumped to >=0.99.0 which
broke backward compatibility with previous releases. This required a
refactoring of most most modules in Ansible OpenStack collection
2.0.0, which thus also broke backward compatibilty with earlier
releases of the 1.x.x collection series.

Now, quickstart.sh must choose collection version depending on the
openstacksdk release which gets installed by the RDO release.

Since quickstart.sh, TripleO CI and RDO releases are tightly coupled
we have to implement this version chooser in three steps:

1. Implement version chooser in quickstart.sh and install the
   collection as well as openstacksdk from a temporary yum
   repository created by Alfredo.
2. Bump the collection and openstacksdk in RDO release and wait for
   component lines and integration line promotions.
3. Remove Alfredo's temporary yum repository from quickstart.sh

This patch accomplishes the first step, introducing the version
chooser logic and introducing Alfredo's temporary yum repository
with a preview RPM of ansible-collections-openstack 2.0.0 and
python3-openstacksdk 0.101.0.

Co-Authored-By: Alfredo Moralejo <amoralej@redhat.com>
