commit_message:
Choose version of Ansible OpenStack collection based on RDO release

Starting with RDO Zed, openstacksdk has been bumped to >=0.99.0 which
broke backward compatibility with previous releases. This required a
refactoring of most most modules in Ansible OpenStack collection
2.0.0, which thus also broke backward compatibilty with earlier
releases of the 1.x.x collection series.

Now, quickstart.sh must choose collection version depending on the
openstacksdk release which gets installed by the RDO release.

Since quickstart.sh, TripleO CI and RDO releases are tightly coupled
we have to implement this version chooser in three steps:

1. Implement version chooser in quickstart.sh and install the
   collection as well as openstacksdk from a temporary yum
   repository created by Alfredo.
2. Bump the collection and openstacksdk in RDO release and wait for
   component lines and integration line promotions.
3. Remove Alfredo's temporary yum repository from quickstart.sh

This patch accomplishes the first step, introducing the version
chooser logic and introducing Alfredo's temporary yum repository
with a preview RPM of ansible-collections-openstack 2.0.0 and
python3-openstacksdk 0.101.0.

Co-Authored-By: Alfredo Moralejo <amoralej@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic7660a85079688be206b8fb63f76add333ba68f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/86/861586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install openstack.cloud release depending on the RDO release if is not installed # # The optional version part of the SCM pointer must be a valid semantic version [1] # because ansible-galaxy will use it to compare with existing collection installs # and otherwise will fail with "Non integer values in LooseVersion" [2]. # [1] https://semver.org/ # [2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2109807 if [[ ! -d $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections/ansible_collections/openstack/cloud ]]; then if [[ $QUICKSTART_RELEASE =~ .*(train|victoria|wallaby).* ]]; then retry 10 ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ git+https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack,stable/1.0.0 \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections else # FIXME(jmeng): Replace commit hash with 'master' once Ansible OpenStack collection 2.0.0 has been released retry 10 ansible-galaxy collection install -vvv --force \ git+https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack,ed36d82a0c60a841d2f30c61a50d60531481b2cc \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections fi fi

commit_message:
Updates for zed stable branch creation

- Set default branch for git review/gerrit to stable/zed
- Switch tests to stable.
- Switch to using stable charm-helpers branch.
- Switch to using stable charm.openstack branch.
- Switch to using stable zaza, zaza-openstack-tests
  branch
- (reactive charms) Add build.lock file
- (classic charms) make sync
- (reactive: not reactive plugin): lock charm-tools < 3.1
- (reactive: with reactive plugin): lock charm snap to 3.x/stable

Change-Id: I15d6662d536704eb15d8b64698bda559bdb02b8f

commit_message:
Ensure tox.ini is ASCII

The left/right single quotation marks cause an ascii decode error in
some python3.6 environments.

flake8 H216 is ignored since train still supports py27, so needs
third-party mock.

W503,W504 are also ignored to fix stable/train gate.

Change-Id: I1675929d410ab46278fcac001eae4a1aea321126
(cherry picked from commit 72677fcaecb5e358839510393e3dc5b4ea796ab3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/37/829837/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix pre_live_migration rollback
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-31 13:10:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1944619.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1944619-fix-live-migration-rollback.yaml', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b26964cb61c691ddd63e0a45f95024c55af63e82', 'message': "Fix pre_live_migration rollback

During the pre live migration process, Nova performs most of the
tasks related to the creation and operation of the VM in the destination
host. That is done without interrupting any of the hardware in the source
host. If the pre_live_migration fails, those same operations should be
rolled back.

Currently nova is sharing the _rollback_live_migration for both
live and pre_live migration rollbacks, and that is causing the source
host to try to re-attach network interfaces on the source host where
they weren't actually de-attached.

This patch fixes that by adding a conditional to allow nova to do
different paths for migration and pre_live_migration rollbacks.

Closes-bug: #1944619
Change-Id: I784190ac356695dd508e0ad8ec31d8eaa3ebee56
(cherry picked from commit 63ffba7496182f6f6f49a380f3c639fc3ded9772)
(cherry picked from commit 379e54fe49b3343a0734c96574789614e3d83b49)
(cherry picked from commit a09d29b0bc537b9770d8dc4d7c1a6584798539f7)
(cherry picked from commit a7c7c09d3e129f76b7c13607f6bc65d3c5f161e9)

commit_message:
Fix pre_live_migration rollback

During the pre live migration process, Nova performs most of the
tasks related to the creation and operation of the VM in the destination
host. That is done without interrupting any of the hardware in the source
host. If the pre_live_migration fails, those same operations should be
rolled back.

Currently nova is sharing the _rollback_live_migration for both
live and pre_live migration rollbacks, and that is causing the source
host to try to re-attach network interfaces on the source host where
they weren't actually de-attached.

This patch fixes that by adding a conditional to allow nova to do
different paths for migration and pre_live_migration rollbacks.

Closes-bug: #1944619
Change-Id: I784190ac356695dd508e0ad8ec31d8eaa3ebee56
(cherry picked from commit 63ffba7496182f6f6f49a380f3c639fc3ded9772)
(cherry picked from commit 379e54fe49b3343a0734c96574789614e3d83b49)
(cherry picked from commit a09d29b0bc537b9770d8dc4d7c1a6584798539f7)
(cherry picked from commit a7c7c09d3e129f76b7c13607f6bc65d3c5f161e9)
(cherry picked from commit b8caf1f4857c6b23775cda5f671bd316845cf274)

commit_message:
Fix success_url parameter issue for Edit Snapshot

The "success_url" param is used when updating the project snapshot
[1] and it lacks sanitizing the input URL that allows an attacker to
redirect the user to another website. This patch update 'Updateview'
class to not use the "sucess_url" method.

Closes-bug: #1982676

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/snapshots/views.py#L109

Change-Id: Ied142440965b1a722e7a4dd1be3b1be3b3e1644b

commit_message:
Update the ctlplane_dns_nameservers value

ctlplane_dns_nameservers needs to be pointing to
the ctlplance dns so that compute node connect
to the controller node.

It also drops dns_search_domains, tripleo_ovn_dbs
vars. As it is already defined in
external-data-plane-management role [1].

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/843835

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I286fb7d777697ac638d0e90b1bfc443c4422999d

commit_message:
[requirements] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Id0e664537ddb72a6d267db30e14a8d64f1c8abb3

commit_message:
Bump rabbitmq version back

With commit [1] rabbitmq version has been bumped quite extremely
so that with upgrade to V or even W there will be downgrade of rabbitmq
which is really best to avoid.

Mentioned patch was released under EM and was never released. So it's
better to bump rabbit version down to the version V and W have.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/850350

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/853029/
Change-Id: I5b17878d497504f7bd97b2dccd72ecc28484b249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/29/861729/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Under Extended Maintenance RabbitMQ version was bumped to 3.8.30 which is higher version then used on V or W releases. This only affects users who track stable/ussuri branch instead of being on specific tags. RabbitMQ version is now downggraded from 3.8.30 to 3.8.14. If you have already upgraded to newer RabbitMQ version we suggest defining ``rabbitmq_package_version: 3.8.30-1`` in your user_variables and keep that for Victoria and Wallaby releases.

commit_message:
Use legacy image retrieval for CentOS 7

CentOS has dropped cloud image we relied on for LXC contaners.

Let's fetch image from linuxcontainers.org instead to workaround this.

Change-Id: If2c33590258c90ec8d522bad5545b6f626c9772a
(cherry picked from commit a9a84714f55331d36d2328ea5bdc8babec07a2a1)

commit_message:
Fix image_url missing from instance_info

The 'image_url' property of instance_info is populated by
deploy_utils.build_instance_info_for_deploy() method. The
anaconda deploy interface never called this method to
populate the instance_info.

Change-Id: Ic2a6cccf456b5ec90cc12abcb86d883774438aca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/24/817524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The anaconda deploy interface did not build the instance_info for deployment. Specifically the instance_info of the node was never populated with the 'image_url'.

commit_message:
[test-only] OverflowError running on 32-bit systems

Change I59b1579dc9877668b82d4195431c1 added tests that mock an
input buffer, but the mocked return_value for __len__ exceeds the
allowable maximum value for an index in the CPython implementation
on 32-bit systems.  Fix this by using half the value and allowing
the buffer to be called twice during the tests.

Change-Id: Iaba20c01fb4d994cd738a570197f8f6f04f22606
Closes-bug: #1991406
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/04/860004/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # CPython implementation detail: __len__ cannot return > sys.maxsize, # which on a 32-bit system is 2*units.Gi - 1 # https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#object.__len__ fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = units.Gi read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, fakebuffer, None])) # CPython implementation detail: __len__ cannot return > sys.maxsize, # which on a 32-bit system is 2*units.Gi - 1 # https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#object.__len__ fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = int(expected_volume_size / 2) read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, fakebuffer, None])) # CPython implementation detail: __len__ cannot return > sys.maxsize, # which on a 32-bit system is 2*units.Gi - 1 # https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#object.__len__ fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = int(expected_volume_size / 2) read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, fakebuffer, None]))
deleted_lines: fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = expected_volume_size read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, None])) fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = expected_volume_size read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, None])) fakebuffer.__len__.return_value = expected_volume_size read=mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[fakebuffer, None]))

commit_message:
Add stable/zed jobs on master gate

As zed is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I04b4acadd2864ab3160a97888dbb912c18951907

commit_message:
Fix app cred create without project_id for domain admins

Users with domain admin role that are not cloud admins are
not able to get scoped context and create an application
credential with project_id, so this change forces the
scoped context in that particular case.

Closes-bug: #1827120
Change-Id: I076a97a6f943ab74a2db8bc5179a7db194009db4
(cherry picked from commit 6eeaf9852478e25ff77c21117664ac126c5357a4)
(cherry picked from commit 778a52e66aeab883b31db729e04944eeecfec6a2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/03/861303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def keystoneclient(request, admin=False, force_scoped=False): if (is_domain_admin(request) and not is_domain_context_specified and not force_scoped): # NOTE(ganso): users with domain admin role that are not cloud admins are # not able to get scoped context and create an application credential with # project_id, so only in this particular case we force a scoped context force_scoped = False if (request.user.project_id and request.session.get("domain_token") and not policy.check( (("identity", "identity:update_domain"),), request)): force_scoped = True manager = keystoneclient( request, force_scoped=force_scoped).application_credentials
deleted_lines: def keystoneclient(request, admin=False): if is_domain_admin(request) and not is_domain_context_specified: manager = keystoneclient(request).application_credentials

commit_message:
Refactoring node-health validation

node-health validation will now be using openstack-ansible-collection
modules to obtain information about cloud structure and state.

This will allow the validation to be executed in environments with
more strict authentication requirements.
Documentation was updated to provide more information about authentication
procedure used.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id3f332b7fd70a54d537dabec447ffa22a36256fd

commit_message:
Fix cinderlib RBD keyring issue

On Change-Id Iae63aee973932b2eef26d832a7f413a04bad0df1 we added back the
support for the rbd_keyring_conf option to Cinder, but the
functionality is not complete, because it only fully works when the
configuration file is located under /etc/ceph.

This patch fixes support for non /etc/ceph locations.

No release note has been added since this is a functionality that is
only possible through cinderlib (adding the config option in cinder.conf
does nothing) and we don't want to create unnecessary noise.

Change-Id: Idf123c4fa2b3cea1cb7b5cb78c0c610b0f29dd2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/846054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test___get_target_config_cinderlib(self): # OpenStack usage doesn't have the rbd_keyring_conf Oslo Config option cfg_file = '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring' self.driver.configuration.rbd_keyring_conf = cfg_file res = self.driver._get_target_config(None) expected = {'conf': '/etc/ceph/my_ceph.conf', 'name': 'nondefault', 'secret_uuid': None, 'user': 'cinder', 'keyring_file': cfg_file} self.assertDictEqual(expected, res)

commit_message:
Install bridge-utils package

While looking at a failure in an openstack-helm change, there
was a command not found when running the gather-host-logs task:

  node-1 | /bin/bash: line 7: brctl: command not found

Explicitly install the bridge-utils package.

Change-Id: I6e69e0c69190f722482dfc2e9a46a4a3a8144c73

commit_message:
Switch to tracking stable/ussuri for EM release

This will bring the ussuri branch to be working again.
We also set upgrade jobs to non-voting for EM branches

commit_message:
Revert "[FIPS] Exclude gnutls 3.7.6 which is failing on fips"

This reverts commit 2d2fbe3ba6ca1edb6b2b31d587ef4cf6054fb0fb.

Reason for revert: this version is no longer available
Fixed version gnutls-3.7.6-11.el9 is now published:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2119822#c7

Note: It is not a clean revert
The content provider jobs are failing with following error[1]:
```
Packages for argument containers-common-1-40.el9 available, but not installed.
```
It modifies the downgrade command to downgrade a containers-common
package only if it is installed.

[1]. https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/75f028ea950349c9a2653f6d2aa2a157/log/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/repo_setup.log#220

Related-Bug: #1984237

Change-Id: I888b446518f30b3f63f9f566c4341a0ad289b51d

commit_message:
[TRAIN-ONLY] Fix file permissions for octavia

This is a regression from [1]. We need allow
writing these files in config-dowlad directory.

Related-Bug: #1990988
[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:bug%252F1990226

Change-Id: Ie347d87e59189c0e27f20bb9424f74dc2c8ac858

commit_message:
[trivial] Simplify dict get call by removing unused default

The default value of the dictionary get method is None,
so remove the default value of None in the get method

commit_message:
[OVN] Allow to execute ``MetadataProxyHandler`` in a local thread

If configuration option "metadata_workers=0", the OVN metadata agent
will try to spawn the ``MetadataProxyHandler`` instance inside a local
thread, instead of creating a new process. In this case, the method
``MetadataProxyHandler.post_fork_initialize`` is never called and the
SB IDL is never created.

This patch passes the OVN metadata agent SB IDL instance to the proxy
handler instance. This also reduces the number of OVN database active
connections.

Closes-Bug: #1993181
Change-Id: If9d827228002de7e3a55be660da266b60b0dfb79
(cherry picked from commit f43891bf866b65ceef0e51633afbbf57ee2a6be8)

subject: Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for updates.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-20 13:19:52.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/6dfac70dfb4c9f79632c5a4e80a93b89969196f0', 'message': "Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for updates.

In the minor update workflow, we were using the dnf Ansible
module to ensure that the right streams were enabled. However,
the dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Installing packages which were
not installed before the update.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled). Letting the minor update's
workflow 'dnf update *' take care of installing the packages.

Change-Id: I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f
Related-bug: rhbz#1963164
(cherry picked from commit 5746310b69f5e61d635b1b938f357835781ef939)
(cherry picked from commit fbac7ea405f33503d1141864ca6be2ea66c74a6d)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for updates.

In the minor update workflow, we were using the dnf Ansible
module to ensure that the right streams were enabled. However,
the dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Installing packages which were
not installed before the update.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled). Letting the minor update's
workflow 'dnf update *' take care of installing the packages.

Change-Id: I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f
Related-bug: rhbz#1963164
(cherry picked from commit 5746310b69f5e61d635b1b938f357835781ef939)
(cherry picked from commit fbac7ea405f33503d1141864ca6be2ea66c74a6d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/11/862111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure DNF modules have the right stream enabled tripleo_dnf_stream: name: "{{ item.module }}:{{ item.stream }}" state: enabled
deleted_lines: - name: Ensure DNF modules have the right stream dnf: name: "@{{ item.module }}:{{ item.stream }}/{{ item.profile|default('common') }}" state: present

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Icdd02302d88067cfa61114018965c7222002b74a

commit_message:
Fix delete image tests.

Add wait until checkbox is in active state.

Fix edit_image_description_and_name test.
Add wait until the name text box is filled by default name (is not empty).
In the other case selenium write new name into text box faster than default
name is written there so default name then rewrite the new name.

Change-Id: I56803e19dd80180cc432ca872a28a7ee7f41290d

commit_message:
Use absolute path for rally plugin dir check

These tasks failing when running on jammy nodes,
Fix by using absolute path as while checking stat
zuul user is used and while using these path stack
user is used.

Change-Id: Ie181478ff4979aaf5ef889b26ee6025cd801dc7b

commit_message:
Add required projects where necessary

Most of the jobs needs required-projects to be added, especially in
stable branches, where the lack of them causes gate failures.

Since the templates openstack-python3-jobs-neutron and
periodic-stable-jobs-neutron don't contain all the necessary projects
for bagpipe we need to add them one by one.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

NOTE(elod.illes): conflict is due to py36 jobs are still present in
stable/yoga. py39 job is part of openstack-python3-yoga-jobs-neutron,
so this also needs the required projects to be added.
periodic-stable-jobs-neutron template contains openstack-tox-docs,
openstack-tox-py36 and openstack-tox-py38 for stable/yoga.

Change-Id: Iceb92b157d5e875090a0dedec37c398716b89495
(cherry picked from commit 7a02ee3188a4cadba76d75ea03400b35a33c2e5f)
(cherry picked from commit 1b474c3333b25970431ade31d90a38af3f47fb7a)

commit_message:
Remove OVN gap minimum bandwidth support

Since [1], ML2/OVN mechanism driver supports minimum bandwidth
QoS rules. This support was implemented in OVN v22.06.0.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/842292

Related-Bug: #1982951
Change-Id: I52fd399ff9580df3e30d3aa66b3f54882897e6cf
(cherry picked from commit 34b81ae9b7eecf8be09e0147650110e05add5c40)

commit_message:
designate: Enable Sink only when designate is enabled

A recent patch [1] enabled sink related changes to nova/neutron even
when designate is not enabled. This patch fixes that.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/802301

Change-Id: I6d76f342a7cdbcc61d1522689ea489b60353adcd
(cherry picked from commit b4ff2ad9819f9934881eddb9da04481994a59288)

commit_message:
Switch to using hostnames for addressing

K8S pods can change IP during charm upgrades; switch to using
the fully qualified hostname for participating units for
connectivity between units.  Hostnames won't change and are
dynamically managed by K8S.

Most of this is wrapped up in ops-sunbeam and interface changes
for the ovsdb relation.

Depends-On: Ief5c816ab5fbeb55aadf2b83697858f2ecb28807
Change-Id: Ib3d94afcea094b6d31bd12cf8f3934e711f2db8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-k8s refs/changes/60/862260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: """Library for the ingress relation. This library contains the Requires and Provides classes for handling the ingress interface. Import `IngressRequires` in your charm, with two required options: - "self" (the charm itself) - config_dict `config_dict` accepts the following keys: - service-hostname (required) - service-name (required) - service-port (required) - additional-hostnames - limit-rps - limit-whitelist - max-body-size - path-routes - retry-errors - rewrite-enabled - rewrite-target - service-namespace - session-cookie-max-age - tls-secret-name See [the config section](https://charmhub.io/nginx-ingress-integrator/configure) for descriptions of each, along with the required type. As an example, add the following to `src/charm.py`: ``` from charms.nginx_ingress_integrator.v0.ingress import IngressRequires # In your charm's `__init__` method. self.ingress = IngressRequires(self, {"service-hostname": self.config["external_hostname"], "service-name": self.app.name, "service-port": 80}) # In your charm's `config-changed` handler. self.ingress.update_config({"service-hostname": self.config["external_hostname"]}) ``` And then add the following to `metadata.yaml`: ``` requires: ingress: interface: ingress ``` You _must_ register the IngressRequires class as part of the `__init__` method rather than, for instance, a config-changed event handler. This is because doing so won't get the current relation changed event, because it wasn't registered to handle the event (because it wasn't created in `__init__` when the event was fired). """ import logging from ops.charm import CharmEvents from ops.framework import EventBase, EventSource, Object from ops.model import BlockedStatus # The unique Charmhub library identifier, never change it LIBID = "db0af4367506491c91663468fb5caa4c" # Increment this major API version when introducing breaking changes LIBAPI = 0 # Increment this PATCH version before using `charmcraft publish-lib` or reset # to 0 if you are raising the major API version LIBPATCH = 9 logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) REQUIRED_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS = { "service-hostname", "service-name", "service-port", } OPTIONAL_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS = { "additional-hostnames", "limit-rps", "limit-whitelist", "max-body-size", "retry-errors", "rewrite-target", "rewrite-enabled", "service-namespace", "session-cookie-max-age", "tls-secret-name", "path-routes", } class IngressAvailableEvent(EventBase): pass class IngressCharmEvents(CharmEvents): """Custom charm events.""" ingress_available = EventSource(IngressAvailableEvent) class IngressRequires(Object): """This class defines the functionality for the 'requires' side of the 'ingress' relation. Hook events observed: - relation-changed """ def __init__(self, charm, config_dict): super().__init__(charm, "ingress") self.framework.observe(charm.on["ingress"].relation_changed, self._on_relation_changed) self.config_dict = config_dict def _config_dict_errors(self, update_only=False): """Check our config dict for errors.""" blocked_message = "Error in ingress relation, check `juju debug-log`" unknown = [ x for x in self.config_dict if x not in REQUIRED_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS | OPTIONAL_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS ] if unknown: logger.error( "Ingress relation error, unknown key(s) in config dictionary found: %s", ", ".join(unknown), ) self.model.unit.status = BlockedStatus(blocked_message) return True if not update_only: missing = [x for x in REQUIRED_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS if x not in self.config_dict] if missing: logger.error( "Ingress relation error, missing required key(s) in config dictionary: %s", ", ".join(missing), ) self.model.unit.status = BlockedStatus(blocked_message) return True return False def _on_relation_changed(self, event): """Handle the relation-changed event.""" # `self.unit` isn't available here, so use `self.model.unit`. if self.model.unit.is_leader(): if self._config_dict_errors(): return for key in self.config_dict: event.relation.data[self.model.app][key] = str(self.config_dict[key]) def update_config(self, config_dict): """Allow for updates to relation.""" if self.model.unit.is_leader(): self.config_dict = config_dict if self._config_dict_errors(update_only=True): return relation = self.model.get_relation("ingress") if relation: for key in self.config_dict: relation.data[self.model.app][key] = str(self.config_dict[key]) class IngressProvides(Object): """This class defines the functionality for the 'provides' side of the 'ingress' relation. Hook events observed: - relation-changed """ def __init__(self, charm): super().__init__(charm, "ingress") # Observe the relation-changed hook event and bind # self.on_relation_changed() to handle the event. self.framework.observe(charm.on["ingress"].relation_changed, self._on_relation_changed) self.charm = charm def _on_relation_changed(self, event): """Handle a change to the ingress relation. Confirm we have the fields we expect to receive.""" # `self.unit` isn't available here, so use `self.model.unit`. if not self.model.unit.is_leader(): return ingress_data = { field: event.relation.data[event.app].get(field) for field in REQUIRED_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS | OPTIONAL_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS } missing_fields = sorted( [ field for field in REQUIRED_INGRESS_RELATION_FIELDS if ingress_data.get(field) is None ] ) if missing_fields: logger.error( "Missing required data fields for ingress relation: {}".format( ", ".join(missing_fields) ) ) self.model.unit.status = BlockedStatus( "Missing fields for ingress: {}".format(", ".join(missing_fields)) ) # Create an event that our charm can use to decide it's okay to # configure the ingress. self.charm.on.ingress_available.emit()

commit_message:
docs: Add warnings about password selection

Some services fail when using special characters in passwords, add some
warnings to our docs.

Closes-Bug: 1744985
Change-Id: I601149e2e7362507b38f01719f7197385a27e0a8

added_lines: .. warning:: Only use alphanumeric characters in your passwords, as some services fail to work when using special characters.

commit_message:
Use legacy image retrieval for CentOS 7

CentOS has dropped cloud image we relied on for LXC contaners.

Let's fetch image from linuxcontainers.org instead to workaround this.

is configured/deployed. This fixes a condition inside the
``os_ironic`` module.

commit_message:
Do not user urljoin for deprecated script

The problem is that urljoin does drop path after FQDN which results in
wrong result URL. os.path.join on contrary will just drop first argument
So we use stupid join of the list through `/` which can add extra one
even if it's not needed. But by far it's the best thing we can do.

Change-Id: I11c83628b0c33146a36e58c9de85e4a1a99bd9ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/43/862143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

def test_statsd_client_non_defaults(self): def test_statsd_client_bad_name(self): conf = {'log_statsd_host': 'my.host.com'} # First test with a colon (:) with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as err: utils.get_logger(conf, 'some:name', log_route='some-route') self.assertEqual(str(err.exception), "statsd metric names may not contain a colon; " "tail_prefix 'some:name' is invalid") # First test with a new line (
) with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as err: utils.get_logger(conf, 'some
name', log_route='some-route') self.assertEqual(str(err.exception), "statsd metric names may not contain a newline; " "tail_prefix 'some\nname' is invalid") # or when we use the set_prefix function logger = utils.get_logger(conf, 'some-name', log_route='some-route') self.assertEqual(logger.logger.statsd_client._prefix, 'some-name.') # First test with a colon (:) with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as err: logger.set_statsd_prefix("new:prefix") self.assertEqual(str(err.exception), "statsd metric names may not contain a colon; " "tail_prefix 'new:prefix' is invalid") # Then test with a colon (:) with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as err: logger.set_statsd_prefix("new
prefix") self.assertEqual(str(err.exception), "statsd metric names may not contain a newline; " "tail_prefix 'new\nprefix' is invalid")

commit_message:
Allow the user to set the VRF settings

Allow the user to configure the VRF settings to e.g. run
multiple agents per host.

The constants OVN_BGP_NIC, OVN_BGP_VRF and OVN_BGP_VRF_TABLE
have been replaced by configurable config options:

- OVN_BGP_NIC renamed to bgp_nic (default: "bgp-nic")
- OVN_BGP_VRF renamed to bgp_vrf (default: "bgp-vrf")
- OVN_BGP_VRF_TABLE renamed to bgp_vrf_table_id (default: 10)

Change-Id: I863e7bb140cd85a4ecefe6ccaad8adc5eae0cbd9

- Purge removed devices from history
- Make history work when increasing part powers

- Purge removed devices from history
- Make history work when increasing part powers
- Make history work when decreasing replica count (max 1, and if any

  whatever entries it can find
- Ensure builders without history can grow history
- Rename FixedLengthReader to SectionReader
- Add read_ring_table/write_ring_table helpers for v2 rings

commit_message:
Ring v2/history follow-up

- Only rotate history when we've got new trackable history
- Purge removed devices from history
- Make history work when increasing part powers
- Make history work when decreasing replica count (max 1, and if any
  parts move for balance, they get priority)
- Change get_last_part_node to get_last_part_nodes -- have it yield out
  whatever entries it can find
- Ensure builders without history can grow history
- Rename FixedLengthReader to SectionReader
- Add read_ring_table/write_ring_table helpers for v2 rings

Change-Id: I777f52706974ebc5172cf22a3bf18ca11495a185

added_lines: self._dev_id_bytes = ring_data._dev_id_bytes def dev_id_bytes(self): if self._replica2part2dev_id: # There's an assumption that these will all have the same itemsize, # but just in case... return max(part2dev_id.itemsize for part2dev_id in self._replica2part2dev_id) else: return self._dev_id_bytes @property def get_last_part_nodes(self, part): Return an iterator of nodes that were previously primaries for the given part :returns: An iterator of zero or more node dicts, each with an ``index`` key indicating the replica for which they were responsible return for part2dev, part2index in zip(self._past2part2dev_id, self._past2part2index): dev_id = part2dev[part] if dev_id == none_dev_id(self.dev_id_bytes): continue try: index = part2index[part] yield dict(self.devs[dev_id], index=index) except IndexError: raise continue for last_primary in self.get_last_part_nodes(part): if last_primary['id'] not in used: # negate the sign and increment the index by 1 so we know # what index but that it's an old one. This way we can # determine if it's authoritative or not. I.e # old index -> becomes # 0 -> -1; 1 -> -2; 2 -> -3 last_primary['index'] = -1 * (last_primary['index'] + 1) yield last_primary used.add(last_primary['id'])
deleted_lines: def get_last_part_node(self, part, rebalances_ago=1): Return the node that was a primary for the given part up to x rebalances ago. So long as x is <= the history_count stored in the ring. :param rebalances_ago: What point in history (rebalaces ago) to look. :returns: Node if it exists and was moved at that time for that part. return None elif rebalances_ago > len(self._past2part2dev_id): return None dev_id = self._past2part2dev_id[rebalances_ago - 1][part] if dev_id != none_dev_id(self._past2part2dev_id[0].itemsize): try: index = self._past2part2index[rebalances_ago - 1][part] return dict(self.devs[dev_id], index=index) except IndexError: pass return None last_primary = self.get_last_part_node(part) if last_primary and last_primary['id'] not in used: # negate the sign and increment the index by 1 so we know what # index but that it's an old one. This way we can determine # if it's authoritative or not. I.e # old index -> becomes # 0 -> -1; 1 -> -2; 2 -> -3 last_primary['index'] = -1 * (last_primary['index'] + 1) yield last_primary used.add(last_primary['id'])

commit_message:
Updates for zed stable branch creation

- Set default branch for git review/gerrit to stable/zed
- Switch tests to stable.
- Switch to using stable charm-helpers branch.
- Switch to using stable charm.openstack branch.
- Switch to using stable zaza, zaza-openstack-tests
  branch
- (reactive charms) Add build.lock file
- (classic charms) make sync
- (reactive: not reactive plugin): lock charm-tools < 3.1
- (reactive: with reactive plugin): lock charm snap to 3.x/stable

Change-Id: Iac7eedf4021ab181a541dc657aa3239721f209a3

commit_message:
backups: Use the most recent available backup for incrementals

Previously we chose the most recent backup and then crashed out
if it wasn't available. That behavior meant that once
any backup has an error state incremental backups fail
forever after.

Closes-Bug: #1974092
Change-Id: Ie5001c5ac6ccd7d033e7a0b97ef254570a9f75a7

commit_message:
Add poetry-core to build dnspython

The commit f9a11fd unpinned dnspython, the newer version of it requires
poetry-core to be built and 'pip download' doesn't capture that
requirement. Some charms have been migrated to binary charms, but not
all of them have been migrated, this change gives those more time to
transition.

Change-Id: I0656d8a902eeede56fe0315a9db782b1c707c26c

commit_message:
Fix test_ids_ctxt test due to charmhelpers change.

The unit_tests.test_neutron_api_context.
    IdentityServiceContext.test_ids_ctxt test failed due to a change in
charmhelpers[1] which introduced app data.  This introduced a new
function check into the IdentityServiceContext (remote_service_name())
which wasn't mocked out.

 - c-h sync to bring in latest/master version of c-h
 - mock out the remote_service_name()

[1] 4137a3d5d676ed6f332504b4edfcdf7f06c2f0bc (charm-helpers)

Change-Id: I052b1d837674cadfbdcf4e0975ef5cf82b800a72

added_lines: get_iface_for_addressdef get_invalid_vips(): """Check if any of the provided vips are invalid. A vip is invalid if it doesn't belong to the subnet in any interface. If all vips are valid, this returns an empty list. :returns: A list of strings, where each string is an invalid vip address. :rtype: list """ clustered = is_clustered() vips = config('vip') if vips: vips = vips.split() invalid_vips = [] if clustered and vips: for vip in vips: iface_for_vip = get_iface_for_address(vip) if iface_for_vip is None: invalid_vips.append(vip) return invalid_vips

commit_message:
zuul: Declare queue at top level

Zuul deprecated declaring shared queues at a pipeline level with
release 4.1.0. This updates the job definition to use the top level
declaration instead.

Change-Id: Ifd674efb349e0c3156606c8fce72a176f8d05b0f

commit_message:
Support role specific MessageOfTheDay

This implements support for overriding the MessageOfTheDay parameter for
individual roles, so that users can set different motd text for each
role.

Change-Id: I113da365e685b024720753e7a09be32109c96c9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/75/861575/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add tripleo_etcd ansible role

currently used puppet-etcd is not a openstack repo, so the
process of updating etcd configuation is complex and time taking.

This patch will introduce a ansible role 'tripleo_etcd' which
replaces puppet-etcd.
This new role generates the etcd configuration based on latest
etcd V3.4

Change-Id: Ia3cf58512c35cd1c2501c606df6fc0f4e4438120

commit_message:
Switch glance to be in standalone mode.

Switch the glance service to be in standalone mode rather than
being server via mod_wsgi. This change is inline with upstream
documentation. "mod_wsgi: This deployment method is not recommended
for using Glance. The mod_wsgi protocol does not support
Transfer-Encoding: chunked and therefore makes it unsuitable for
use with Glance." *1. The documentation also explicitly recommends
standalone "...the Glance project team recommends that Glance be run
in its normal standalone configuration, particularly in production
environments."

When using mod_wsgi apache translates /<model-name> to /. In the
neutron charm this translation is handled by api-paste.ini. A
similar approach does not seem to work with glance, glance always
interprets the mode-name as a requested version number. To get
around this this change adds apache infront of glance to handle
the translation.

*1 https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/apache-httpd.html#mod-wsgi

Change-Id: I013f1029c3b3f480b23c6bdf92eb155533c526b9

commit_message:
Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for undercloud upgrade

Dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Dnf module installs
packages which were not installed before the undercloud upgrade.
As a result some packages are installed in step0, and not as it
should be done in step3.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled).

This is the same change that was made for minor update workflow,
but for undercloud upgrade. [1]

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f

Change-Id: I3c24f6c0b1877caca225d532e2c40cabe9095577

post-deploy: add public-openrc.sh

commit_message:
Use Inspector database to store inspection data

Ironic inspector supports different backends for storing introspection
data. Originally, the database was not an option, so Kayobe provided an
inspection_store nginx container that poses as a Swift object store.
It is now possible to store the data in the Inspector database, and
there is even a tool to migrate the data between stores. The database
option is simpler, and avoids running the nginx container.

This change switches to use the database store by default. The release
note provides information on how to migrate.

Story: 2010205
Task: 45929

Change-Id: I9c07e87ee43b3b56c3047ba983c42201dc659c82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/34/851834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Changes the default store for the overcloud's Ironic Inspector introspection data from the ``nginx`` based ``inspection_store`` container to use the MariaDB database. This avoids the requirement for the ``inspection_store`` container, and it will be removed on upgrade. *Prior* to upgrading, the existing data may be migrated to the database, by running the following on the controller that runs the ``inspection_store`` container: ``sudo docker exec -it ironic_inspector ironic-inspector-migrate-data --config-dir /etc/ironic-inspector/ --from swift --to database`` Alternatively, to continue using the ``inspection_store`` container, set ``inspector_store_enabled`` to ``true`` in ``$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/inspector.yml``.

commit_message:
Revert "Add Kinetic and Zed support"

This reverts commit c0beec6fa2e5d36985cb1219f75a99c04e3879ae.

Reason for revert: I think this should be reverted as it removes focal support from the rabbitmq-server master, and thus this won't cherry-pick cleanly to the stable/jammy channel for the 3.9 track.

Change-Id: Iebab77fcc0cee31af66980c2d3be334fffe06222

commit_message:
tripleo_logrotate_crond: add for standalone roles

Adds the new tripleo_logrotate_crond role.

Change-Id: I9b8c09ad69bef16d0ef187b67bfa39e1baa6cf27
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

to get only .yml, not .yaml. Since the "cleanup.yml" is called in

commit_message:
Split tripleo_nftables tasks

It will make integration into standalone playbooks easier. We also keep
the "main" for backward compatibility reasons.

We also take the opportunity to empty nftables if we're moving from
iptables to nftables; this ensure nothing will interfer.

This action is only done if we switch the firewall engine, meaning,
mostly, during a fresh deploy, or an upgrade. If it happens during an
upgrade, the services using the firewall will already be shut down,
therefore there won't be any weird behavior.

Note: this patch also changes the file extension to match molecule need
to get only .yml, not .yaml. Since the "cleanup.yml" is called in
different places in molecule, this patch must update multiple places at
once.

Change-Id: I761bcf06b01e7890182ec610ca4345c1ecb5707b

added_lines: # systemctl will return 0 if enabled, 3 if disabled - name: Get nftables service state ansible.builtin.command: systemctl status nftables register: nftables_status failed_when: nftables_status.rc not in [0, 3] - name: Switch firewall engine when: - nftables_status == 3 block: # systemctl will return 0 if success, 1 if unit not found - name: Ensure legacy iptables services are off become: true ansible.builtin.command: "systemctl disable --now {{ item }}" register: ipt_service failed_when: - ipt_service.rc not in [0, 1] loop: - iptables.service - ip6tables.service - name: Ensure nftables service is enabled and running become: true ansible.builtin.systemd: name: nftables state: started enabled: true
deleted_lines: # systemctl will return 0 if success, 1 if unit not found - name: Ensure legacy iptables services are off become: true ansible.builtin.command: "systemctl disable --now {{ item }}" register: ipt_service failed_when: - ipt_service.rc not in [0, 1] loop: - iptables.service - ip6tables.service - name: Ensure nftables service is enabled and running become: true ansible.builtin.systemd: name: nftables state: started enabled: true

commit_message:
Switch OVN relation handlers to use hostnames

Hostnames are resolvable under K8S and won't change when Pods
get refreshed during charm upgrades.

Rework OVN relation handlers to be hostname centric.

Note that this part of the codebase does not currently have
any test coverage.

Change-Id: Ief5c816ab5fbeb55aadf2b83697858f2ecb28807

subject: [RBD] Parallelize writes on image creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-08-28 11:55:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/5a69db7e20222ecb5372a08b58fa7fbc6af926ac', 'message': '[RBD] Parallelize writes on image creation

This change adds [glance_store]rbd_store_write_multiplier config opiton,
that will be used to parallelize the image writes into ceph, by simply
increasing the amount of data written at once. Instead of writing only
rbd_store_chunk_size MiBs at a time, it will write
rbd_store_chunk_size * rbd_store_write_multiplier MiBs.

Default value of the new option is 1 for complete backward compatibility
with prior behaviour. Setting it to values more than 1 will increase the
upload speed of very big images into ceph.

Change-Id: I2d7bfcc4baebdd6169ae77c20caf55428227b44d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-11-09 12:04:16.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_opts.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/5bc418288ca7f056112c387f5481661871bf04c7', 'message': '[RBD] Parallelize writes on image creation

This change adds [glance_store]rbd_store_write_multiplier config opiton,
that will be used to parallelize the image writes into ceph, by simply
increasing the amount of data written at once. Instead of writing only
rbd_store_chunk_size MiBs at a time, it will write
rbd_store_chunk_size * rbd_store_write_multiplier MiBs.

Default value of the new option is 1 for complete backward compatibility
with prior behaviour. Setting it to values more than 1 will increase the
upload speed of very big images into ceph.

Change-Id: I2d7bfcc4baebdd6169ae77c20caf55428227b44d
'}]
commit_message:
[RBD] Parallelize writes on image creation

This change adds [glance_store]rbd_store_write_multiplier config opiton,
that will be used to parallelize the image writes into ceph, by simply
increasing the amount of data written at once. Instead of writing only
rbd_store_chunk_size MiBs at a time, it will write
rbd_store_chunk_size * rbd_store_write_multiplier MiBs.

Default value of the new option is 1 for complete backward compatibility
with prior behaviour. Setting it to values more than 1 will increase the
upload speed of very big images into ceph.

Change-Id: I2d7bfcc4baebdd6169ae77c20caf55428227b44d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/07/748607/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_thick_provisioning_with_custom_multiplier(self): """Assert 'rbd.Image.write' is called the correct amount of times.""" self.config(rbd_store_chunk_size=1, rbd_store_write_multiplier=4) self.store.configure() self.store.chunk_size = self.store.WRITE_CHUNKSIZE = units.Ki verifier = mock.MagicMock(name='mock_verifier') image_id = 'fake_image_id' file_size = 5 * units.Ki # 5K file_contents = b"*" * file_size file_contents_first_chunk = b"*" * 4 * units.Ki file_contents_second_chunk = b"*" * units.Ki image_file = six.BytesIO(file_contents) with mock.patch.object(rbd_store.rbd.Image, 'write') as mock_write: self.store.add(image_id, image_file, file_size, verifier=verifier) self.assertEqual(2, mock_write.call_count) verifier.update.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(file_contents_first_chunk), mock.call(file_contents_second_chunk)])

'}, {'number': 65, 'created': '2022-10-10 06:46:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/afd3a66dffda11231b3351bbbb13f48edf2c121d', 'message': 'Add standalone-roles role and its playbook

standalone-roles is a new role to deploy standalone compute
node by using tripleo-ansible roles.

This role includes:
- Bootstrap the env for deployment
- Deploy standalone when compute_on_same_host is set to true
- Generate the config from standalone deployment
- Deploy the compute services on the standalone host or on single node.
- Generate the required inventory for target host when
  compute_on_target_host is set to true
- Deploy compute services on target host

It will be used in tripleo-external-compute-deployment-pipeline
job template[1]

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836

Note: container-prep is dropped as a dependency from standalone roles.
As it is not needed.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I476c7299dec209c89db87e2182a35ec6a4924f92
'}, {'number': 66, 'created': '2022-10-10 06:48:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/6e35cac76d07521fd020750ec68ac8bfd5135975', 'message': 'Add standalone-roles role and its playbook

standalone-roles is a new role to deploy standalone compute
node by using tripleo-ansible roles.

This role includes:
- Bootstrap the env for deployment
- Deploy standalone when compute_on_same_host is set to true
- Generate the config from standalone deployment
- Deploy the compute services on the standalone host or on single node.
- Generate the required inventory for target host when
  compute_on_target_host is set to true
- Deploy compute services on target host

It will be used in tripleo-external-compute-deployment-pipeline
job template[1]

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836

Note: container-prep is dropped as a dependency from standalone roles.
As it is not needed.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I476c7299dec209c89db87e2182a35ec6a4924f92

'}, {'number': 88, 'created': '2022-10-12 08:53:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/bccf2ff7bc08412fa97108072f0dcea23002d65d', 'message': 'Add standalone-roles role and its playbook

standalone-roles is a new role to deploy standalone compute
node by using tripleo-ansible roles.

This role includes:-
- On first node, Deploy the standalone
- Generate 99 standalone vars
- On Second node, Bootstrap the node
- Copy 99 standalone vars from undercloud to subnode-1
- Deploy Compute services

It will be used in tripleo-external-compute-deployment-pipeline
job template[1]

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836

Note: container-prep is dropped as a dependency from standalone roles.
As it is not needed.

standalone-roles is a new role to deploy standalone compute
node by using tripleo-ansible roles.

This role includes will run on two nodes and does following
things:
- Bootstrap first node and deploy standalone
- Generate 99 standalone vars and copy it to second node
- Bootstrap second node and install packages
- Copy 99 standalone vars to tripleo-inventory
- Deploy compute serices.

It will be used in tripleo-external-compute-deployment-pipeline
job template[1]

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836

commit_message:
Add EDPM role and playbook for standalone-compute deployment

external-data-plane-management role is a new role to deploy
standalone compute node by using tripleo-ansible roles.

This role includes will run on two nodes and does following
things:
- Bootstrap first node and deploy standalone
- Generate 99 standalone vars and copy it to second node
- Bootstrap second node and install packages
- Copy 99 standalone vars to tripleo-inventory
- Deploy compute serices.

It will be used in tripleo-external-compute-deployment-pipeline
job template[1]

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/843836

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I476c7299dec209c89db87e2182a35ec6a4924f92

commit_message:
bnr - Update on rear scripts to support the ceph bnr on LVM

Due to the inclusion of lvm and the creation of different logical volumes, the backup and restore scripts for the /var/lib/ceph folder need to be adapted. It is required to change the directory path.
Closes-Bug: rhbz#2118397 - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/2118397
Change-Id: I5ad1f2c968be5087b71d7db2626ea96fe4959b25
(cherry picked from commit 3804820bf7cb950c2c5e85e66232e0cd5deb8e1a)

commit_message:
Add a separate /boot partition

The overcloud-hardened-uefi-full image now has a separate partition
mounted to /boot. This means grub no longer needs to mount the root
partition. This will allow trying layouts which grub doesn't support,
such as LVM thin-provisioning. Since grub now uses the common path of
loading an ext4 /boot partition, early boot may now be more robust, or
have better error messages for incorrectly built images.

Change-Id: I27be9c3e82ed20dcfc7a6f7dcb992006d44f933f
(cherry picked from commit e57e998b0e8069aba4ce1a2082389105e750c05e)

commit_message:
Adds ability to configure ProxySQL's max replication lag

By default ProxySQL's default value of max_replication_lag
is 0 which is in fact disabling this feature [1].
If it is greater than 0, ProxySQL will regularly monitor
replication lag and if it goes beyond the configured threshold
it will temporary shun the host until replication catches up.

This should be configurable via kolla-ansible as every
openstack deployment can be different in terms of network
delays, database load etc.. , so user should have option
to configure when database backend will be shunned.

[1] https://proxysql.com/documentation/main-runtime/

Change-Id: I66171638abc712cb84b380042f1d29f54c499e73

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I184132a0901ddfdb279d4ab5892b2bcee92aafd0

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib52c8a1d830942d663e65eb99271de17c886816e

commit_message:
Adds new Neutron Designate DNS integration test

Test name: "test_vm_uses_dns_resolver"
Scenario:
1) Create dst-vm, ensure recordset type "A" creation on backends
2) Create src-vm and try to PING dst-vm using its FQDN
   Should PASS if DNS queries are forwarded to DNS resolver as
   expected.
Note: this test is covering:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/yoga/admin/config-dns-res.html#case
-2b-queries-are-forwarded-to-dns-resolver-s-configured-on-the-host

Change-Id: Ie9f3a9aac500c33c644c6e7c4656cbb0331f3399
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/18/858518/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_tempest_plugin.common import ssh cls.secgroup = cls.os_primary.network_client.create_security_group( name=data_utils.rand_name('secgroup'))['security_group'] cls.security_groups.append(cls.secgroup) cls.create_loginable_secgroup_rule(secgroup_id=cls.secgroup['id']) cls.create_pingable_secgroup_rule(secgroup_id=cls.secgroup['id']) def _create_server(self, name=None, setup_sec_group=None): if setup_sec_group: port = self.create_port( self.network, security_groups=[self.secgroup['id']]) else: port = self.create_port(self.network) class DNSIntegrationResolversTests(BaseDNSIntegrationTests): @decorators.idempotent_id('38705b5c-38be-11ed-8091-201e8823901f') def test_vm_uses_dns_resolver(self): # Create dst-vm, ensure "A" type recordset name = data_utils.rand_name('dst-vm') dst_vm = self._create_server(name=name, setup_sec_group=True) dst_vm_ip = dst_vm['fip']['floating_ip_address'] self._verify_dns_records(dst_vm_ip, name) dst_vm_domain_name = name + '.' + self.zone['name'].strip('.') # Create src-vm name = data_utils.rand_name('src-vm') src_vm = self._create_server(name=name, setup_sec_group=True) src_vm_ip = src_vm['fip']['floating_ip_address'] # SSH to src-vm and ping dst-vm using its domain name. Should PASS # if DNS queries are forwarded to DNS resolver as expected. ssh_client = ssh.Client( src_vm_ip, CONF.validation.image_ssh_user, pkey=self.keypair['private_key']) ping_command = 'ping -c1 {}'.format(dst_vm_domain_name) try: ssh_client.exec_command(ping_command) except lib_exc.SSHExecCommandFailed as ex: raise ex

commit_message:
Pin stable branch jobs nodeset to Ubuntu Focal (20.04)

In 2023.1 cycle. we are moving the default distro
version of Ubuntu to Jammy (22.04)[1] so we need to pin
the nodeset for stable branch job in master gate so that
they continue run on their supporting distro version which is
Ubuntu Focal since stable/victoria.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-ci-jobs-to-ubuntu-jammy.html

Change-Id: If2608dfec183f97727972348b72b0f72a3535b21

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7398d1ee2c08bbaa8464dd882aa9992af700eacf

commit_message:
Pin stable branch jobs nodeset to Ubuntu Focal (20.04)

In 2023.1 cycle. we are moving the default distro
version of Ubuntu to Jammy (22.04)[1] so we need to pin
the nodeset for stable branch job in master gate so that
they continue run on their supporting distro version which is
Ubuntu Focal since stable/victoria.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-ci-jobs-to-ubuntu-jammy.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/861836
Change-Id: I1cf6bd24bf00b445ccb0e87702edd84db4d5f2a1

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

commit_message:
designate: Enable Sink only when designate is enabled

A recent patch [1] enabled sink related changes to nova/neutron even
when designate is not enabled. This patch fixes that.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/802301

Change-Id: I6d76f342a7cdbcc61d1522689ea489b60353adcd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/58/861958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow multiple segments per host for routed networks

Routed networks today prevents multiple segments from being configured
for a single hypervisor. This has the ill effect of preventing IP
scaling such that a host is only allowed to pull from one segment of
subnets. This segment has realistic restrictions for broadcast domain
that keeps it from growing too large. With only access to one segment,
the host can run out of IPs. More detail contained within the spec.

This document identifies the problem, describes a typical use-case for
large deployments on routed networks, and delves into some proposed
solutions to remove this restriction.

Changes:
Patch 1-2: Initial Draft
Patch 3: Fix nits, grammar, some TODOs, and references.
Patch 4: Addressed feedback from reviews

Change-Id: Idf6c441e02077e6d5d791dc37da8e8add50c73ff
Related-Bug: #1764738
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/70/657170/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Multiple Segments Per Host Support for Routed Networks ====================================================== Today Neutron has support for segments within a routed network. However, there is validation that preventing multiple segments within a individual network or host [1]_. This restriction prevents natural growth of IP space within an individual network. The intent of this spec is to deliver on the promise of routed networks to allow a single network that users can choose where IPs scale and grow as the network needs to grow. * Launchpad RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1764738 * PoC Review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623115 Problem Description =================== Currently in routed networks there is a hard restriction for having only a *single segment per host* [1]_. The effects of this restriction are: * Single segment per host * Subnets within these segments are not able to grow without negative effects of ever increasing broadcast domain. The end result is when you are configured with a Routed Networks, we're restricting the growth that was part of the original promise of routed networks. Use-case: *Operator's network hits IP space limitations.* Typical steps to get there: * Operator deploys Neutron with Routed Network configured. * Operator adds first network with one segment. * Operator adds a subnet to the segment with a /22 (1024 IPs). At this point there is a reasonable broadcast domain. * The cloud deployment becomes successful enough require scaling up to 4k IP addresses Within the same physical L2 boundary. * Problem Encountered: * Operator cannot add the additional 3k addresses to existing segment because broadcast domain would become too large. This causes a need for additional VLAN(s) to be created (More Segments) * Operator is restricted from adding new segment to network with existing code [1]_. * Operator's work-around today is to keep adding networks until the IP needs are met. This confuses operators and users when they have multiple networks to choose from. * **Problem**: Restricting to one segment per host is not scalable across IP space with large physical L2 boundaries. This also makes it more difficult for operators to operate and explain to users. The goal of this feature is to remove the restriction of 1 segment per host thus allowing Operators to grow IP space within a physical L2 as needs demand. Proposed Change =============== The basic need here is to allow multiple physical network segments to be attached to the same host. With that premise, the PoC [4]_ identified the following needs: (More needs may be discovered as this is solved) 1. Remove the HostConnectedToMultipleSegments exception and checks for it [1]_. #. Change all code that assumes a 1-1 relationship with network and segment into a 1-many relationship [2]_. #. Generate IDs based on segment_id rather than network_id (i.e. bridge_name) The following code shows 1-1 relationship [3]_. #. Ensure new 1-many relationship (network -> segment) can be supported by driver implementors. #. Migration paths may be need depending on driver implementation. #. Ensure all drivers that support routed networks allow for more than one **Potential Impacts** * API and Client Changes * Unknown, but expected to be minor if so. There may be data that comes back from an existing API the expects one item to be returned, when there may now be many after this change. TODO: Research this. * Routing, Drivers and Agents * OVS * (will need community support to ascertain this) * LinuxBridge * When bridge names change from network_id-based to segment_id-based, the LinuxBridge driver will need to be modified to support this as well as any code needed to ensure 1-many relationship between networks to segments on hosts ([9]_). * Some PoC code deployed today [4]_. * Have identified other code assuming single segment per host: [7]_, [8]_. * May have other implications to stein-based changes such as *Change provider network segmentation ID*: [10]_. * SRIOV * (will need community support to ascertain this) * ETC * (will need community support to ascertain this) * Out-of-tree plugins/drivers * (will need community support to ascertain this) * Migrations * LinuxBridge: There has been a migration at GoDaddy for LinuxBridge driver located here with a plan ([5]_) and scripts ([6]_) used during migration. This migration ran against live hypervisors and affected showed little effect to live customers (<10 seconds network blip for a few customers. * As discussed in PTG (Denver 2019), * A migration could be performed automatically by the agent when launched that detects missing bridges. The agent might iterate its segments (should only be one) and ensure a bridge exists for each segment it is connected to. * If agent approach is not feasible or safe, create "how we did it, use at your own risk" documents for others to adopt. * Documentation * Add this change to features * Modify any user docs regarding routed networks * Document (if necessary) migration techniques (see Migrations above) * Other??? * Initial Release * (will need community support to ascertain this) * Concerns and Requests * We, GoDaddy, would like to request that the solution include the part above concerning "Generate IDs based on segment_id rather than network_id (i.e. bridge_name)". We invested in finding a PoC solution and now have live customers that have been ported with this assumption. Deviating from this would likely require another port and potential downtime. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. LaunchPad bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1764738 Proof of Concept WIP: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/623115 .. [1] Validation in `neutron/objects/subnet.py`: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/faa4438daea289af869ff12c19bd53d75ab3225e/neutron/objects/subnet.py#L319-L330 .. [2] AgentManagerBase.add_network (and all uses of its self.network_map): https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/cbee0f9f88ff34f70ff19590471b5405e06ff2a9/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/_agent_manager_base.py#L62-L68 .. [3] LinuxBridge Example of a creating bridge only for one network (should be segment_id based) https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/cbee0f9f88ff34f70ff19590471b5405e06ff2a9/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py#L164-L171 .. [4] Existing WIP (PoC) patch applied that does many steps for the conversion. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/623115 .. [5] Implemented plan at GoDaddy that migrated LinuxBridge version. TODO: fix this link when I land from flight .. [6] Scripts that were part of the LinuxBridge migration. TODO: Get this paste link when we land .. [7] Network delete assuming single segment per agent (and thus host) https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/a6997efae63042eed66451ea0094769977404ed5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/agent/macvtap_neutron_agent.py#L54-L74 .. [8] Internal map whose key is network_id can only have one value https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/07969cfe15e02b37af392cce58b154210aad64ad/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/_agent_manager_base.py#L43 .. [9] Generation of LinuxBridge name based on network ID (rather than segment_id) https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/07969cfe15e02b37af392cce58b154210aad64ad/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py#L165-L172 .. [10] This may affect other Stein based enhancements such as https://github.com/openstack/neutron-specs/blob/master/specs/stein/change-segmentation-id-vlan-provider-network.rst

commit_message:
Add spec for vpnaas OpenVPN driver

Change-Id: I6b02a131078b5729e291cdb0044b2b8289a02a4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/90/680990/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron-vpnaas OpenVPN driver ============================= Launchpad RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1837847 PoC code on gerrit: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666282 Problem Description ------------------- The current IPSEC VPN driver allows connecting two separate networks via a VPN link. Policy based routing is used to direct traffic between the two networks. This proposal introduces a VPN service that allows remote client logins to Neutron networks, placing the remote clients into the same L2 domain as the instances. Proposed Change --------------- We use OpenVPN to provide VPN connectivity, using the option "-dev tap" to provide L2 access (as opposed to "-dev tun"). The OpenVPN server process runs in the namespace of a Router, and it listens on the Router's external IP address. OpenVPN client traffic flows through a tap device created by the VPN server. We create a Linux bridge to connect this tap device to the Router's internal port (see diagram). Without VPN: :: namespace qrouter-* .-----------------------. .-----------------------. | external port | | internal port | | qg-* (10.0.0.42/24) | | qr-* (192.168.0.1/24) | '-----------------------' '-----------------------' With VPN: :: namespace qrouter-* .-----------------------. .--------------------------. | external port | | Linux bridge | | qg-* (10.0.0.42/24) | | qr-br-* (192.168.0.1/24) | '-----------------------' '--------------------------' ^(listens) | | | | | .------------. .--------------. .-----------------------. | vpn server | | tap device | | internal port | '------------' | tap0 (no IP) | | qr-* (no IP) | ^ '--------------' '-----------------------' | ^ '---client traffic -----' Q: should we have the VPN server listen on the internal port? The current proposal runs into problems when we have multiple internal networks for which we want to configure VPN services. OpenVPN server configuration ---------------------------- The OpenVPN server requires the configuration of keys and certificates (CA cert, server cert, server key, DH parameters). Our driver expects to find these in a Barbican container. NOTE: the PoC does not allow configuration of the OpenVPN cipher and auth hash algorithms. They are hard-wired to AES-265-CBC and SHA1. API objects/fields ------------------ The following API objects/fields are required. NOTE: The PoC uses the existing fields of the vpnservice object. It currently does not change existing APIs. +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | Attribute | Description | +================+=========================================================+ | id | Identifies the VPN service. The Barbican container with | | | the server secrets is expected to have a name that | | | equals the vpnservice id. | +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | router_id | Identifies the router that hosts the VPN service | +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | subnet_id | Identifies the Neutron subnet that we want to connect | | | to, and thus the internal Router port that is used. | | | NOTE: PoC does not currently implement this. It fails | | | if the Router has more than one internal port. | +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | external_v4_ip | Bind address of the OpenVPN server. | +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | status | Used by the implementation, but not specific to this | | admin_state_up | proposal. | +----------------+---------------------------------------------------------+ Open question: How are remote clients integrated into Neutron's L3 networks? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Alternative 1: A Neutron Port is created for each remote client. The Port is created when the client connects and destroyed when it disconnects. The client's IP address is assigned by Neutron, and is be obtained by the client through the Neutron DHCP service. The DHCP service of the OpenVPN server is disabled. Does not need additional API objects or fields. Alternative 2: The client needs to create a Neutron Port before login, providing its MAC address. This Port can be persistent, or it can be removed by the client after terminating the VPN session. The client's IP address is assigned by Neutron, and is be obtained by the client through the Neutron DHCP service. The DHCP service of the OpenVPN server is disabled. Does not need additional API objects or fields. Alternative 3: No Neutron Ports are created for remote clients. We configure an IP range for remote clients that does not overlap with the addresses given out by Neutron's DHCP service. We enable the DHCP service of the OpenVPN server and have it allocate addresses from this new range. An additional API object/field is required, holding IP address range for the remote clients. NOTE: The PoC currently implements Alternative 1, but there are some weaknesses in the implementation that would have to be addressed. (See RFE discussion on launchpad)

Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].
